column2: The tithes and taxes for [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] are on their way to [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] castle and my co-conspirators have bribed the guards not to notice if a chest or two should go 'missing'. Everything is ready for the robbery to proceed.
column3: Le convoi transportant la dixme et les taxes collectées pour [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] est sur le chemin du castel. Mes co-conspirateurs ont soudoyé les gardes afin qu'ils ne remarquent point l'éventuelle disparition d'un coffre ou deulx, tout est prest pour effectuer le vol.
column4: The tithes and taxes for [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] are on their way to [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] castle and my co-conspirators have bribed the guards not to notice if a chest or two should go 'missing'. Everything is ready for the robbery to proceed.
column6: The tithes and taxes for [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] are on their way to [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] castle and my co-conspirators have bribed the guards not to notice if a chest or two should go 'missing'. Everything is ready for the robbery to proceed.

column2: We'll all be rich!
column3: A nous la richesse !
column4: We'll all be rich!
column6: We'll all be rich!

column2: The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today and were placed in the treasury. As I was inspecting the chests full of gold, it struck me that there seemed to be fewer of them than what had arrived earlier. A quick check of the treasurer's accounts revealed my worst fears...
column3: Le convoi transportant les imposts et la dixme collectés est arrivé au castel aujourd'hui et les coffres ont été placés dans le trésor. Lorsque nous avons inspecté la livraison, il m'a semblé qu'il en manquait par rapport à la précédente perception. Une vérification rapide des comptes du trésorier a confirmé mes craintes...
column4: The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today and were placed in the treasury. As I was inspecting the chests full of gold, it struck me that there seemed to be fewer of them than what had arrived earlier. A quick check of the treasurer's accounts revealed my worst fears...
column6: The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today and were placed in the treasury. As I was inspecting the chests full of gold, it struck me that there seemed to be fewer of them than what had arrived earlier. A quick check of the treasurer's accounts revealed my worst fears...

column2: I have been robbed!
column3: On m'a volé !
column4: I have been robbed!
column6: I have been robbed!

column2: As the taxes were being hauled into the treasury, several large chests full of gold made their way onto the back of a wagon which left the castle unnoticed. The gold is now safely locked away in my treasury and my co-conspirators have all received their share.
column3: Les taxes ont été transportées dans le trésor, plusieurs grands coffres pleins d'or ont fait leur chemin à l'arrière d'un wagon et ont quitté le castel inaperçu. L'or est désormais en toute sécurité et mes co-conspirateurs ont tous reçu leur part.
column4: As the taxes were being hauled into the treasury, several large chests full of gold made their way onto the back of a wagon which left the castle unnoticed. The gold is now safely locked away in my treasury and my co-conspirators have all received their share.

column2: Everything went as planned!
column3: Tout s'est passé comme prévu !
column4: Everything went as planned!
column6: Everything went as planned!

column2: I have received my share of the money embezzled by [From.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName].
column3: J'ai reçu ma part de l'argent de [From.GetTitledFirstName] détourné par  [From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName].
column4: I have received my share of the money embezzled by [From.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName].

column2: The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today. As I was watching the money being carried into the treasury, I noticed some shadowy figures trying to make off with several chests full of gold. I had my guards seize them, and under questioning they revealed themselves to be in the employ of [From.GetTitledFirstName]. What shall be done with my thieving vassal?
column3: Le convoi transportant la dixme et les taxes collectées arriva au castel aujourd'hui. Alors que je surveillois le transfert, j'ai remarqué quelques silhouettes qui tentoient de faire main basse sur plusieurs coffres pleins d'or. Je les ai mis sur-le-champ aulx fers et pendant l'interrogatoire, ils ont révélé estre à la solde de [From.GetTitledFirstName]. Que faire de ce vassal sournois ?
column4: The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today. As I was watching the money being carried into the treasury, I noticed some shadowy figures trying to make off with several chests full of gold. I had my guards seize them, and under questioning they revealed themselves to be in the employ of [From.GetTitledFirstName]. What shall be done with my thieving vassal?

column2: Forgive [From.GetHerHim]

column4: Forgive [From.GetHerHim]
column6: Forgive [From.GetHerHim]

column2: As the taxes were being hauled into the treasury, my men tried to make off with several chests of gold but were spotted by [From.GetTitledFirstName], who had come out to inspect the process [From.GetHerHim]self. Under questioning they revealed to myself to be in my employ, and now [From.GetTitledFirstName] knows that I attempted to rob [From.GetHerHim].
column3: Le convoi transportant la dixme et les taxes collectées arriva au castel aujourd'hui. Mes hommes ont tenté de faire main basse sur plusieurs coffres d'or, mais ont été repérés par [From.GetTitledFirstName], qui estoit sorti pour inspecter le processus . Ils ont été arresté, et pendant l'interrogatoire ils ont révélé estre à mon service et maintenant [From.GetTitledFirstName] sait que j'ai essayé de [From.GetHerHim] voler.

column2: My co-conspirators have fabricated evidence that [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] is planning a revolt against [Root.PlotTarget.Liege.GetHerHis] liege. The evidence will discreetly find its way into the hands of [Root.PlotTarget.Liege.GetTitledFirstName], who cannot fail to act on it.

column2: As I was getting ready to sleep, I heard a scuffle from outside my bedroom door. Rushing outside, I found that my guards had seized a cloaked man as he was attempting to slip some documents into the room. Under questioning, he revealed that he was working for [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] and that the documents were fabricated evidence intended to turn me against my vassal [From.GetTitledFirstName].
column3: Comme je m'apprestois à dormir, j'ai ouï une bagarre derrière la porte de ma chambre. Me précipitant à l'extérieur l'arme a la main, j'ai constaté que mes gardes avoient saisi un homme masqué alors qu'il tentoit de glisser des documents dans ma chambre. En réponse aulx questions, il a révélé qu'il travailloit pour [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] et que les documents ont été fabriqués dans l'intention de semer la discorde entre mon vassal [From.GetTitledFirstName] et moi.

column2: The sharp decline of my power and territories have not gone unnoticed by other rulers. While I continue to insist on my claims to Imperial dignity, it is clear that my peers no longer take them seriously.
column3: La forte baisse de mon pouvoir et de mes territoires ne sont point passées inaperçues aulx yeulx des aultres souverains. Bien que je continue d'insister sur mes prétentions à la dignité impériale, il est clair que mes pairs ne me prennent plus au sérieulx.
column4: Der starke Rückgang meiner Macht und Territorien hat sich den anderen Herrscher nicht unbemerkt passiert. Während ich auf meinen Anspruch auf dem Kaisertum fortsetze, ist es klar, dass meine Kollegen mich nicht mehr ernst nehmen.
column6: The sharp decline of my power and territories have not gone unnoticed by other rulers. While I continue to insist on my claims to Imperial dignity, it is clear that my peers no longer take them seriously.

column2: The change in crown authority has forced me to change some of my demesne laws.
column3: Le changement de l'autorité de la couronne m'a forcé à changer certaines de mes lois domaniales.
column4: Die Veränderung der Kronautorität hat mich gezwungen, einige meiner Herrschaftgesetze zu verändern.
column6: The change in crown authority has forced me to change some of my demesne laws.

column2: My changes to the crown authority of the Empire have now been fully implemented across the realm.
column3: Le changement d'autorité de la Couronne de l'Empire que j'ai désiré est désormais pleinement mis en œuvre à travers le Royaume.
column4: Meine Änderungen der Krone-Autorität  sind jetzt im ganzen Reich durchgeführt worden.
column6: My changes to the crown authority of the Empire have now been fully implemented across the realm.

column2: This was not a just act!
column3: Ce n'estoit point un acte juste !
column4: Das war kein rechtmäßiger Akt!
column6: This was not a just act!

column2: Oh well
column3: Oh bien !
column4: Nun ja
column6: Oh well

column2: I have reclaimed the Byzantine Empire for the Orthodox faith. The title of Augustus is rightfully mine.
column3: J'ai repris l'Empire Byzantin au nom de la foi Orthodoxe. Le titre d'Augustus est mien de droit.
column4: I have reclaimed the Byzantine Empire for the Orthodox faith. The title of Augustus is rightfully mine.
column6: I have reclaimed the Byzantine Empire for the Orthodox faith. The title of Augustus is rightfully mine.

column2: Glorious day!
column3: Un jour glorieulx !
column4: Glorreicher Tag!
column6: Glorious day!

column2: Following a faith completely different from Catholicism, I cannot legitimately claim to be Latin Emperor.
column3: Étant donné que je suis une foi complètement différente du Catholicisme, je ne puis point me revendiquer comme Empereur Latin.
column4: Following a faith completely different from Catholicism, I cannot legitimately claim to be Latin Emperor.
column6: Following a faith completely different from Catholicism, I cannot legitimately claim to be Latin Emperor.

column2: Following a faith completely different from Orthodoxy, I cannot legitimately claim to be Byzantine Emperor.
column3: Étant donné que je suis une foi complètement différente de l'Orthodoxisme, je ne puis point me revendiquer comme Empereur Byzantin.
column4: Following a faith completely different from Orthodoxy, I cannot legitimately claim to be Byzantine Emperor.
column6: Following a faith completely different from Orthodoxy, I cannot legitimately claim to be Byzantine Emperor.

column2: One of the provinces in your realm has finally seen the light, with the majority of its inhabitants at last accepting your culture. This should make your realm easier to manage and better unify your people.
column3: Une des provinces de votre royaume s'est enfin rendue à la raison, alors que la majorité de ses habitants ont finalement adopté votre culture. Cela devroit rendre votre royaume plus facile à diriger et unifier davantage votre peuple.
column4: One of the provinces in your realm has finally seen the light, with the majority of its inhabitants at last accepting your culture. This should make your realm easier to manage and better unify your people.
column6: Una de las provincias en tu reino finalmente a visto la luz, con la mayor’a de sus habitantes aceptando a tu cultura. Esto debe unir tu reino y hacer lo mas f‡cil de controlar.

column2: Those who have gone into hiding have been sent a message to return.
column3: Those who have gone into hiding have been sent a message to return.
column4: Those who have gone into hiding have been sent a message to return.
column6: Those who have gone into hiding have been sent a message to return.

column2: Following a faith completely different from Catholicism, I cannot legitimately claim to be Holy Roman Emperor.
column3: Étant donné que je suis une foi complètement différente de l'Catholicism, je ne puis point me revendiquer comme Empereur Holy Roman.
column4: Following a faith completely different from Catholicism, I cannot legitimately claim to be Holy Roman Emperor.
column6: Following a faith completely different from Catholicism, I cannot legitimately claim to be Holy Roman Emperor.

column2: As I move to re-assume power in [FromFrom.GetBaseName], I am approached by a cabal of local lords insisting I step down in favour of my heir, lest they rebel again and force the issue...
The Crusade was a great success, but to whom shall I grant the lands I have gained?
column3: La Croisade fut un grand succès, mais à qui accorderois-je les terres que j'ai obtenu?
column4: Der Kreuzzug war ein großer Erfolg. An wen werde ich das neu erworbene Land geben?
column6: The Crusade was a great success, but to whom shall I grant the lands I have gained?

column2: To my son
column3: A mon fils
column4: An meinen Sohn
column6: To my son

column2: To a capable relative
column3: Pour un parent capable
column4: An einen tauglichen Verwandten
column6: To a capable relative

column2: To myself
column3: À moi-mesme
column4: An mich selbst
column6: To myself

column2: To my brother
column3: A mon frère
column4: An meinen Bruder
column6: To my brother

column2: To a valiant retainer
column3: À un preulx serviteur
column4: To a valiant retainer
column6: To a valiant retainer

column2: The Crusade was a great success and now I must decide whether to request a fief in the captured lands for one of my relatives.
column3: La Croisade fut fructueuse, je dois maintenant décider pour quel membre de ma famille je devrois demander un fief, en terre sainte.
column4: The Crusade was a great success and now I must decide whether to request a fief in the captured lands for one of my relatives.
column6: The Crusade was a great success and now I must decide whether to request a fief in the captured lands for one of my relatives.

column2: No, our victory belongs to God
column3: Que nenni, notre victoire appartient à Dieu
column4: No, our victory belongs to God
column6: No, our victory belongs to God

column2: I have distributed fiefs in my new lands among the relatives of the Crusading lords.
column3: J'ai distribué mes nouveaulx fiefs parmis les parents des seigneurs Croisés.
column4: I have distributed fiefs in my new lands among the relatives of the Crusading lords.
column6: I have distributed fiefs in my new lands among the relatives of the Crusading lords.

column2: Little [From.GetFirstName] is the spitting image of [From.GetHerHis] father, [From.Father.GetTitledFirstName]. We are unmarried, of course, but I can hardly deny the child is mine.

column4: Little [From.GetFirstName] is the spitting image of [From.GetHerHis] father, [From.Father.GetTitledFirstName]. We are unmarried, of course, but I can hardly deny the child is mine.
column6: Little [From.GetFirstName] is the spitting image of [From.GetHerHis] father, [From.Father.GetTitledFirstName]. We are unmarried, of course, but I can hardly deny the child is mine.

column4: I love [From.GetHerHim], anyway

column4: The Civil War has weakened the authority of the crown to the point where my own distant and disconnected realm cannot be considered a part of [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] any longer.

column2: We started early, the sun had barely risen above the horizon. There was plenty of prey, the dogs caught many rabbits and I slayed one great boar before he killed my horse and myself.
column3: Nous avons commencé tost, l'astre du jour venoit à peine de percer l'horizon. Les proies abondoient, les chiens ont pris moults lapins et j'ai occis un sanglier avant qu'il ne tue mon cheval et moi-mesme.
column4: Wir fingen früh an, die Sonne hatte sich über dem Horizont kaum erhoben. Es gab viel Beute, die Hunde fingen viele Kaninchen und ich tötete einen großen Eber, bevor er mein Pferd und mich selbst tötete.
column6: We started early, the sun had barely risen above the horizon. There was plenty of prey, the dogs caught many rabbits and I slayed one great boar before he killed my horse and myself.

column2: I'm a hunter
column3: Je suis un(e) chasseur(se)
column4: Ich bin ein Jäger
column6: I'm a hunter

column2: That lifestyle is not for me
column3: Ce mode de vie n'est point pour moi
column4: Diese Lebensweise ist nichts für mich
column6: That lifestyle is not for me

column2: The new bird is almost too perfect. I enjoy every hunt with her, and the cook has trouble finding new recipes for rabbit.
column3: Le nouvel oiseau est presque trop parfait. J'éprouve une grande joie à chaque chasse avec lui et le cuisinier à du mal à trouver de nouveaulx récipients pour conserver les lapins.
column4: Der neue Vogel ist fast zu vollkommen. Ich genieße jede Jagd mit ihm, und der Koch hat Schwierigkeiten, neue Rezepte für das Kaninchen zu finden.
column6: The new bird is almost too perfect. I enjoy every hunt with her, and the cook has trouble finding new recipes for rabbit.

column2: I'm a falconer
column3: Je suis un(e) fauconnier(ière)
column4: Ich bin ein Falkner
column6: Soy un cetrero

column2: I'm never happier than when I'm in my study, poring over some newly imported volume. Books are truly God's greatest gift to man.
column3: Je ne suis jamais aussi heureulx que lorsque je suis à mon étude, étudiant de près quelques nouveaulx manuscrits importés. Les grimoires sont vraiment les plus beaulx cadeaulx que Dieu ait fait aulx hommes.
column4: Ich bin nie glücklicher wenn ich über einem kürzlich importierten Buch brüte. Bücher sind wahrhaft das größte Geschenk Gottes, des Allmächtigen.
column6: I'm never happier than when I'm in my study, poring over some newly imported volume. Books are truly God's greatest gift to man.

column2: I'm a scholar
column3: Je suis un(e) lettré(e)
column4: Ich bin ein Schüler
column6: I'm a scholar

column2: I found the strange book collecting dust in a forgotten corner of the castle library. It took me several weeks of intense study before its mystery revealed itself to me. The gibberish parts was encoded and after many hours trying to decipher I managed to break it and construct a key to make it easier for me to read. Its mystery is still not solved...
column3: J'ai trouvé ce grimoire poussiéreulx dans un coin perdu de la bibliothèque du castel. Cela m'a pris plusieurs semaines d'intenses études avant que je puisse percer son mystère. Les parties pleines de charabia estoient en réalité codées. Après maintes heures et tentatives pour les déchiffrer, j'ai réussi à m'en défaire et à fabriquer une clé me permettant de lire plus facilement. Son mystère n'est toujours point résolu....
column4: Ich fand das fremde Buch, das Staub an einer vergessenen Ecke der Schlossbibliothek sammelt. Ich brauchte mehrere Wochen der intensiven Studie, bevor sein Mysterium sich zu mir offenbarte. Die Kauderwelsch-Teile wurden verschlüsselt und nach vielen Stunden versuchend zu entziffern ich schaffte, es zu brechen und einen Schlüssel zu bauen, es leichter für mich zu machen, zu lesen. Sein Mysterium wird noch immer nicht gelöst...
column6: I found the strange book collecting dust in a forgotten corner of the castle library. It took me several weeks of intense study before its mystery revealed itself to me. The gibberish parts was encoded and after many hours trying to decipher I managed to break it and construct a key to make it easier for me to read. Its mystery is still not solved...

column2: I'm a mystic
column3: Je suis un mystique
column4: Ich bin ein Mystiker
column6: I'm a mystic

column2: My regular excursions into the dungeon have only served to whet my appetite. I have sent for a skilled torturer who will teach me more about the arts of pain.
column3: Mes excursions régulières dans le donjon ont seulement servies à aiguiser mon appétit. J'ai envoyé quérir un bourreau talentueulx qui m'en apprendra plus sur l'art de la douleur.
column4: Meine regelmäßigen Ausflüge in den Kerker haben nur meinem Verlangen nach mehr gedient. Ich habe nach einem Fachpeiniger geschickt, der mich mehr über die Künste des Schmerzes lehren wird.
column6: My regular excursions into the dungeon have only served to whet my appetite. I have sent for a skilled torturer who will teach me more about the arts of pain.

column2: I'm an impaler
column3: Je suis un empaleur
column4: Ich bin ein Pfähler
column6: I'm an impaler

column2: My garden is the apple of my eye, my pride and joy. I distrust my gardener and would spend every hour of the day in my garden if I could.
column3: Mon jardin est la prune de mes yeulx, ma fierté et ma joie. Je me méfie de mon jardinier et passerois ma vie dans mon jardin si je pouvois.
column4: Mein Garten ist wie mein Augapfel, mein Stolz und meine Heiterkeit. Ich misstraue meinem Gärtner und würde jede Stunde des Tages in meinem Garten verbringen, wenn ich könnte.
column6: My garden is the apple of my eye, my pride and joy. I distrust my gardener and would spend every hour of the day in my garden if I could.

column2: I'm a gardener
column3: Je suis un jardinier
column4: Ich bin ein Gärtner
column6: I'm a gardener

column2: My modest attempts to write poetry were never meant to be published in any way, but wherever I go, bards and minstrels are reciting or singing my poems.
column3: Mes modestes tentatives pour écrire de la poésie n'ont jamais été publiées, mais où que j'ailles, bardes et menestrels récitent mes poèmes.
column4: Meine bescheidenen Versuche, Gedichte zu schreiben, waren nie dazu gedacht veröffentlicht zu werden, aber wohin auch immer ich gehe, rezitieren Barden und Minnesänger  meine Gedichte
column6: My modest attempts to write poetry were never meant to be published in any way, but wherever I go, bards and minstrels are reciting or singing my poems.

column2: I'm a poet
column3: Je suis un Poète
column4: Ich bin ein Poet
column6: I'm a poet

column2: After a long time of contemplation and soul-searching it feels as if I could bear to live in complete celibacy for the rest of my life.
column3: Après un long moment de contemplation et de retour sur moi-mesme il semble que je puisse vivre dans un célibat complet jusqu'à la fin de mes jours.
column4: Nach einer langen Zeit des Nachdenkens und der Gewissenserforschung fühlt es sich, als ob ich die Last des Zölibat den Rest meines Lebens ertragen könnte.
column6: After a long time of contemplation and soul-searching it feels as if I could bear to live in complete celibacy for the rest of my life.

column2: There is nothing that brings me more joy than the day-to-day task of ruling [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Some may think it lacks glory, but I do it well enough that I've become known for my prowess.
column3: There is nothing that brings me more joy than the day-to-day task of ruling [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Some may think it lacks glory, but I do it well enough that I've become known for my prowess.
column4: There is nothing that brings me more joy than the day-to-day task of ruling [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Some may think it lacks glory, but I do it well enough that I've become known for my prowess.
column6: There is nothing that brings me more joy than the day-to-day task of ruling [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Some may think it lacks glory, but I do it well enough that I've become known for my prowess.

column2: I'm an administrator!
column3: I'm an administrator!
column4: I'm an administrator!
column6: I'm an administrator!

column2: This lifestyle of utmost pleasure and joyous life suits me perfectly. This can be nothing but heaven.
column3: Ce mode de vie plein de plaisirs extresmes et et de joie de vivre me convient parfaitement. Ce ne peult estre rien d'aultre que le paradis.
column4: Dieser Lebensstil aud purem Vergnügens und freudigen Lebens passt mir vollkommen. Das kann nur der Himmel sein.
column6: This lifestyle of utmost pleasure and joyous life suits me perfectly. This can be nothing but heaven.

column2: I'm a hedonist
column3: Je suis un hédoniste
column4: Ich bin ein Hedonist
column6: I'm a hedonist

column2: The duel was close fought, but in the end I was victorious over my opponent. As I basked in the admiration of my peers, I knew that I had to do this again.
column3: Le duel fut un combat serré et acharné, mais à la fin je parvins à triompher de mon adversaire. Après m'estre enivré de l'admiration de mes pairs, j'ai su que je devais le refaire.
column4: Das Duell war knapp erkämpft, aber schließlich war ich über meinen Gegner siegreich. Als ich mich in der Bewunderung unter meine Gleichen sonnte, wusste ich, dass ich das wieder tun musste.
column6: The duel was close fought, but in the end I was victorious over my opponent. As I basked in the admiration of my peers, I knew that I had to do this again.

column2: I'm a duelist
column3: Je suis un Duelliste
column4: Ich bin ein Duellant
column6: I'm a duelist

column2: I have finally become an expert in Islamic jurisprudence! My knowledge of the Qur'an, the Sunnah, Ijma' (Consensus) and Qiyas (Analogy) is what makes me a faqih and I will use that knowledge to be a better [Root.GetTitle] and ruler of my people.
column3: Je suis enfin devenu un expert en jurisprudence islamique ! Ma connaissance du Coran, de la sunna, de l’ijmas‘ (le consensus) et de la qiyass (l’analogie) font de moi un faqish. J’emploierais mon savoir pour devenir un meilleur [Root.GetTitle] et guide pour mon peuple.
column4: Ich bin endlich ein Experte des islamischen Rechts! Mein Wissen um den Qur'an, die Sunna, Idschma (Konsens) und Qiyas (Analogie) macht mich zu einem Faqih und ich werde dieses Wissen nutzen, um ein besserer [Root.GetTitle] und Herrscher zu sein.
column6: ¡Ya soy un experto en jurisprudencia Islámica! Mis conocimientos del Corán, la Sunna, la Ijma (Consenso) y el Qiyas (Analogía) es lo que me hace un faquí y usaré esos conocimientos para ser un mejor [Root.GetTitle] y gobernante para mi pueblo.

column2: I am proud to have become a faqih!
column3: Je suis fier d’estre devenu un faqish !
column4: Ich bin stolz darauf, ein Faqih geworden zu sein!
column6: ¡Estoy orgulloso de ser un faquí!

column2: Whenever the engineers are working in [Root.Capital.GetName], I always make an effort to visit them and talk. They have such interesting ideas! Building things has always been a pleasure for me, whether they be physical or far more abstract.
column3: Whenever the engineers are working in [Root.Capital.GetName], I always make an effort to visit them and talk. They have such interesting ideas! Building things has always been a pleasure for me, whether they be physical or far more abstract.
column4: Whenever the engineers are working in [Root.Capital.GetName], I always make an effort to visit them and talk. They have such interesting ideas! Building things has always been a pleasure for me, whether they be physical or far more abstract.

column2: I'm an architect!
column3: I'm an architect!
column4: I'm an architect!
column6: I'm an architect!

column2: What goes on behind a battle is far more interesting to me than the actual fighting. Strategies, manoeuvres, even the issues of attrition and supply...these are the things that matter most when it comes to victory, and it applies to far more things than simply the battlefield.
column3: What goes on behind a battle is far more interesting to me than the actual fighting. Strategies, manoeuvres, even the issues of attrition and supply...these are the things that matter most when it comes to victory, and it applies to far more things than simply the battlefield.

column2: Spending time with other people--that's what gives me energy. Talking with them, knowing the things they want or don't want. I've always had a knack for it, and wherever I go you're bound to find me in the centre of the largest and loudest group.
column3: Spending time with other people--that's what gives me energy. Talking with them, knowing the things they want or don't want. I've always had a knack for it, and wherever I go you're bound to find me in the centre of the largest and loudest group.

column2: I watch everything, and I listen. Other people don't see what I see--the cause and effect of every action, the moves and counter-moves that are required to make something happen. When I take action, it's very likely nobody will even know I did it. That is how plans succeed.
column3: I watch everything, and I listen. Other people don't see what I see--the cause and effect of every action, the moves and counter-moves that are required to make something happen. When I take action, it's very likely nobody will even know I did it. That is how plans succeed.

column2: Playing a game well means understanding its inner workings. You must know the rules, you must know your opponent's strengths and weaknesses. It is life and politics played out on the chessboard. I play because I win, and I like winning...and, yes, sometimes just for fun. What could be better?

column2: The re-conquest of Sicily was an astounding success. The pope has motioned to officially crown the King of Sicily today. Already the pope makes plans for future such events, some have even said they’ve heard rumours of such a thing being called a Crusade. Time can only tell what will happen next.
column3: La reconqueste de la Sicile s'est avérée estre une stupéfiante réussite. Le Pape couronnera le Roi de Sicile aujourd'hui. Le Pape ébauche déjà des plans pour rééditer ces événements à l'avenir, certains disent mesme avoir ouï une rumeur comme quoi cela s'appellerait désormais une Croisade. Seul le temps dira ce qu'il adviendra par la suite.

column2: In a very surprising and bold move, the Pope has decided to give the Norsemen of the North a chance to prove themselves worthy of the crown of Sicily. Of course they submitted to papal authority prior to being allowed to invade Southern Italy. This should prove to be a very interesting series of events, no matter the outcome.
column3: Le Pape a, de manière très surprenante et audacieuse, décidé de donner aulx Nordiques de Scandinavie une chance de se prouver dignes de la couronne de Sicile. Bien susr, ils se sont soumis à l'autorité papale avant d'estre autorisés à envahir le Sud de l'Italie. Cela devroit estre une suite d'événements particulièrement intéressante, quel qu'en soit le résultat.
column4: In a very surprising and bold move the Pope has decided to give the Norsemen of the North a chance to prove themselves worthy of the crown of Sicily. column2: After having heard the success of the Normans, the pope has decided to give them an offer they can’t refuse. They’ll be allowed to invade southern Italy with full papal support. Should they succeed, they’ll be crowned by the pope himself as Kings of Sicily.
column3: Après avoir eu vent du succès des Normands, le Pape a décidé de leur faire une offre impossible à refuser. Ils seront autorisés à envahir le l'Italie méridionale avec le plein support du Pape. S'ils remportent la victoire, ils seront couronnés par le Pape lui-mesme Rois de Sicile.
column4: After having heard the success of the Normans, the pope has decided to give them an offer they can’t refuse. They’ll be allowed to invade southern Italy with full papal support. Should they succeed, they’ll be crowned by the pope himself as Kings of Sicily.
column6: After having heard the success of the Normans, the pope has decided to give them an offer they can’t refuse. They’ll be allowed to invade southern Italy with full papal support. Should they succeed, they’ll be crowned by the pope himself as Kings of Sicily.

column2: Having heard the news of southern Italy’s struggle, some Croatian mercenaries have volunteered to help the pope. Impressed by their determination and self-sacrifice, he has decided to give official papal support to these mercenaries to take back Italy. Should they succeed, the crown of Sicily awaits them.
column3: Ayant eu vent des épreuves endurées par l'Italie méridionale, des mercenaires croates ont offert leurs services au Pape. Impressionné par leur determination et leur abnégation, il a décidé de leur accorder un soutien papal officiel pour reprendre l'Italie. S'ils remportent la victoire, la couronne de Sicile les attendra.

column2: Often forgotten, there are still resident Greeks in southern Italy. After having affirmed their support of the Pope of Rome they now seek to re-conquer their lost lands from the heathen invaders. Motivation is certainly not lacking for these people.

column2: Your Grace, the vile Polish have taken the Moravian territories from us and in their naivity they think they could claim the Duchy of Bohemia as well! Of course we could defeat them single-handedly, the problem is that they are a little bit more powerful at the moment and so we should probably resort to some more cunning tactics...
column3: Votre Majesté, ces vils Polonais nous ont pris les territoires moraves et dans leur naïveté, ils songent pouvoir aussi prétendre au Duché de Bohème ! Bien susr, nous pourrions les vaincre à nous tout seuls, mais le problesme est qu'ils sont un peu plus puissants que nous pour le moment et nous devrions donc nous résoudre à employer des tactiques rusées...

column2: The Bulgarian state has finally perished by your hands and their 'empire' has collapsed into ruins. The conflict that has lasted decades is over and we can rejoice that our northern borders are safe once more and our control of the Balkans is undisputed. For this achievement you are going to be known for at least another millennium.
column3: L'Etat Bulgare a enfin péri de vos mains et leur empire s'est effondré en ruines. Le conflit qui a duré des décennies est enfin terminé et nous pouvons nous réjouir que nos frontières septentrionales soient à nouveau susres et notre controsle des Balkans incontesté. Pour avoir accompli tout cela, vous allez estre célèbre pour au moins un millénaire.
column4: The Bulgarian state has finally perished by your hands and their 'empire' has collapsed into ruins. column2: My lord, nothing less than a miracle has occured. We have repelled the full scale Byzantine invasion and our Empire is safe once more. But discontent is growing in the Roman lands and the position of the Basileus is balancing on the edge. Maybe we could benefit from that?
column3: Mon seigneur, rien de moins qu'un miracle vient d'avoir lieu. Nous avons repoussé l'assaut tout entier de l'invasion Byzantine et notre Empire est de nouveau susr. Mais le mécontentement grandit dans les terres romaines et la position du Basileus est plus que fragile. peult-estre pourrions-nous en profiter ?

column2: As could be expected, after learning of your intention to attack him, the Pope has cast the Anathema on you. You are now excommunicated.

column2: Our suzerain is now marching against the true Pope. Our suzerain has temporal authority over us, but the Pope's spiritual authority comes from God Himself! Shall we join the Guelfs, defenders of the Holy Father?
column3: Notre suzerain fait la guerre au Pape légitime. Notre suzerain detient sur nous l'autorité temporelle, mais l'autorité spirituelle du Pape découle de Dieu Lui-mesme! Devrions-nous rejoindre les Guelphes, défenseurs du Saint-Père ?
column4: Unsere Suzerän jetzt führt Krieg gegen den wahren Papst. Unsere Suzerän hat weltliche Autorität über uns, aber geistliche Autorität des Papstes kommt von Gott selbst! Sollten wir die Guelfen, Verteidigern des Heiliger Vater, beitreten?
column6: Nuestro señor feudal está marchando en contra del verdadero Papa. Nuestro señor feudal tiene la autoridad temporal sobre nosotros, pero la autoridad espiritual del Papa viene de Dios mismo!¿Hay que unirse a los güelfos, defensores del Papa?

column2: We have founded the Jomsvikings, a brotherhood of berserker warriors who wear wolf-skins and unleash their fury on the enemies of the Norse!

column2: The Jomsvikings

column2: A band of fierce Vikings have established a warrior brotherhood. These Jomsvikings are devoted to Thor, Odin and the other Norse gods. They brook no quarter on the battlefield and will permit only the strongest and ablest warriors amongst their number.\n\nThough there are those who would dismiss them as simple brigands, the Jomsvikings have vowed to defend all Norse lands being encroached by Christendom or other foreign religions.
column3: Une bande de féroces Vikings a établi une fraternité de guerriers. Ces Jomsvikings vouent un culte à Thor, à Odin et à d'autres dieux nordiques. Ils ne font pas de quartier sur le champ de bataille et n'admettent que les plus forts et les meilleurs dans leurs rangs.\n\nBien que certains les considèrent comme de simples brigands, les Jomsvikings ont pour mission de défendre toutes les terres nordiques qu'envahissent le christianisme et d'autres religions étrangères.
column4: Eine Bande grimmiger Wikinger hat eine Bruderschaft der Krieger. Huldigen die Jomswikinger Thor, Odin und den anderen nordischen Göttern. Gnadenlos auf dem Schlachtfeld, erlauben sie nur die stärksten und besten Krieger in ihren Reihen.\n\nAuch wenn es jene gibt, die sie verächtlich als einfache Räuber bezeichnen, so haben die Jomswikinger doch geschworen, alle nordischen Länder gegen die schleichende Ausbreitung des Christentums und andere, fremde Religionen zu verteidigen.
column6: Una banda de feroces Vikingos ha establecido una hermandad guerrera. Estos Jomsvikings son devotos de Thor, Odín y los otros dioses Nórdicos. Aguantan sin cuartel en el campo de batalla y sólo los guerreros más fuertes y más capaces están entre ellos.\n\nAunque están aquellos que los rechazan como a simples bandidos, los Jomsvikings se han comprometido a defender a todos los países Nórdicos que estén invadidos por el Cristianismo o cualquier otras religiones extranjeras.

column2: Like the Pharaohs of ancient times, [From.GetTitledFirstName] and [From.GetPossPronoun] [GetFromNewRelation] [New.GetTitledFirstName] have gotten married under the blessed auspices of the gods, ensuring fullness and Order. We can collect a Royal Aid Duty to pay for the ceremonies.
column3: Tels les Pharaons d'antan, [From.GetTitledFirstName] et [From.GetPossPronoun] [GetFromNewRelation] [New.GetTitledFirstName] se sont mariés sous les auspices bénis des dieulx, s'assurant ordre et richesse. Nous pouvons collecter une Taxe d'Assistance Royale pour payer la cérémonie.
column4: Like the Pharaohs of ancient times, [From.GetTitledFirstName] and [From.GetPossPronoun] [GetFromNewRelation] [New.GetTitledFirstName] have gotten married under the blessed auspices of the gods, ensuring fullness and Order. We can collect a Royal Aid Duty to pay for the ceremonies.

column2: The Jewish moneylenders are here, reminding me of that loan I took...
column3: Les presteurs juifs viennent me rappeler mon emprunt...
column4: The jewish moneylenders are here, reminding me of that loan I took...
column6: The jewish moneylenders are here, reminding me of that loan I took...

column2: For as long as have ruled here we Normans have entrusted the raising of our children to Greek, Maghreb, and Italian nursemaids. Our first words would not be Norman French but something else. As we grew up, we learned to speak a tongue that was neither one nor the other. Now is this time to make this tongue our own so we may all communicate.
column3: Depuis que nous régnons ici, nous les Normands, nous confions l’éducation de nos enfants à des gouvernantes grecques, maghrébines ou italiennes. Nos premiers mots ne sont point du françois normand mais une aultre langue. Et en grandissant, nous apprenons à parler une langue qui n’est ni l’une ni l’aultre. Il est temps de nous approprier cette langue afin que nous puissions tous communiquer.
column4: Während meiner gesamten Herrschaft hier haben wir Normannen das Aufziehen unserer Kinder Kindermädchen anvertraut. Unsere ersten Worte waren kein normannisches Französisch. Beim Heranwachsen lernten wir eine Sprache, die dazwischen lag. Jetzt ist es an der Zeit, uns diese Sprache zu eigen zu machen, damit wir alle kommunizieren können.
column6: Mientras hemos gobernado aquí, los normandos hemos confiado la educación de nuestros hijos a niñeras. Nuestras primeras palabras no fueron normandas. A medida que crecíamos aprendimos a hablar una lengua que no era ni una ni otra. Ahora es el momento de hacer nuestra esta lengua para que todos nos comuniquemos.

column2: No, I wish to remain [Root.Culture.GetName]
column3: No, I wish to remain [Root.Culture.GetName]
column4: No, I wish to remain [Root.Culture.GetName]
column6: No, I wish to remain [Root.Culture.GetName]

column2: Around our lands more people are using this Sicilian language and I find this is a perfect means for a [Root.Culture.GetName] overlord to get his multicultural serfs to work properly. We continue to use our own influence to promote this means of communication in the interests of a more efficient realm.
column3: Sur nos terres, un nombre croissant de manants parlent sicilien, ce qui me semble estre un moyen idéal pour un seigneur [Root.Culture.GetName] de faire travailler convenablement ses serfs. Nous continuons à user de notre influence pour promouvoir ce moyen de communication qui contribue à servir les intérests du royaume et à asseoir sa puissance.
column4: Um unser Territorium herum sprechen immer mehr Leute diese sizilianische Sprache. Für einen [Root.Culture.GetName] Oberherrn ist sie meiner Meinung nach ein perfektes Mittel, Leibeigene zu ordentlicher Arbeit anzuhalten. Zum Zwecke eines effizienteren Reichs werden wir unseren Einfluss weiter zur Förderung dieser Kommunikationsweise einsetzen.
column6: Cada vez hay más gente en nuestras tierras que usan el siciliano, algo que considero perfecto para que un señor [Root.Culture.GetName] haga trabajar adecuadamente a sus siervos. Seguimos fomentando este vehículo de comunicación para que el reino sea más eficiente.

column2: Although every civilised man in Christendom knows that French is the true language of communication, this new Sicilian language does have a certain functionality. I have therefore prevailed upon a member of my court to adopt this for everyday administrative use.
column3: Bien que tous les hommes civilisés de la chrétienté sachent que le français est la vraie langue de la communication, cette nouvelle langue sicilienne s’avère très commode. J’ai donc eu gain de cause sur un membre de ma cour afin qu’elle soit adoptée pour l’emploi administratif quotidien.
column4: Obwohl jeder zivilisierte Mann der Christenheit weiß, dass Französisch die einzig wahre Kommunikationsform ist, hat diese neue sizilianische Sprache auch einen gewissen Nutzen. Aus diesem Grund habe ich ein Mitglied meines Hofes dazu gedrängt, sie für das tägliche Verwaltungsgeschäft zu übernehmen.
column6: Aunque todos los hombres civilizados de la cristiandad saben que el francés es la verdadera lengua de comunicación, el nuevo idioma siciliano tiene cierta funcionalidad. He convencido a un miembro de mi corte de que lo adopte como lengua administrativa de uso cotidiano.

column2: I was considering important business when I had an amazing insight. To strengthen my realm I must bring my vassals round to my way of thinking. This involves communication. If I can get them to communicate like me then I will have a much smoother running realm.
column3: Je réfléchissois à une affaire importante lorsque j’ai eu une idée étonnante. Pour renforcer mon royaume, je dois convertir mes vassaulx à ma façon de penser. Cela passe par la communication. Si je parviens à leur faire adopter mon mode de communication, mon royaume fonctionnera bien mieulx.
column4: Beim Nachdenken über ein wichtiges Geschäft kam ich zu einer erstaunlichen Einsicht: Zur Stärkung meines Reichs muss ich meine Vasallen von meiner Denkweise überzeugen, und dazu gehört auch die Kommunikation. Wenn ich es schaffen könnte, dass alle wie ich kommunizieren, so wäre mein Reich viel einfacher zu regieren.
column6: Estaba ocupado con asuntos importantes cuando tuve una súbita revelación. Para reforzar mi reino debo lograr que mis vasallos compartan mi forma de pensar. Eso implica comunicación. Si logro que se comuniquen como yo mi reino funcionará mucho mejor.

column2: My Liege has persuded me to embrace this notion of Sicilianness that is sweeping the realm.
column3: Mon suzerain m'a persuadé d'embrasser cette notion de Sicilianité qui déferle sur  le Royaume.
column4: My Liege has persuded me to embrace this notion of Sicilianness that is sweeping the realm.
column6: My Liege has persuded me to embrace this notion of Sicilianness that is sweeping the realm.

column2: He made me an offer I couldn't refuse.
column3: Il m'a fait une offre que je n'ai pu refuser.
column4: Er machte mir ein Angebot das ich nicht ausschlagen konnte
column6: He made me an offer I couldn't refuse.

column2: For as long as have ruled here we Greeks have entrusted the raising of our children to Norman, Maghreb, or Italian nursemaids. Our first words would not be Byzantine Greek but something else. As we grew up, we learned to speak a tongue that was neither one nor the other. Now is this time to make this tongue our own so we may all communicate.
column3: Depuis que nous régnons ici, nous confions l’éducation de nos enfants à des gouvernantes normandes, maghrébines ou italiennes. Nos premiers mots sont dans une aultre langue que le grec. Et en grandissant, nous apprenons à parler une langue qui n’est ni l’une ni l’aultre. Il est temps de nous approprier cette langue afin que nous puissions tous communiquer.
column4: Während meiner gesamten Herrschaft hier haben unserer Kinder Kindermädchen anvertraut. Unsere ersten Worte waren kein unsere. Beim Heranwachsen lernten wir eine Sprache, die dazwischen lag. Jetzt ist es an der Zeit, uns diese Sprache zu eigen zu machen, damit wir alle kommunizieren können.
column6: Mientras hemos gobernado aquí, los hemos confiado la educación de nuestros hijos a niñeras. Nuestras primeras palabras no fueron nuestras. A medida que crecíamos aprendimos a hablar una lengua que no era ni una ni otra. Ahora es el momento de hacer nuestra esta lengua para que todos nos comuniquemos.

column2: Around our lands more people are using this Sicilian language and I find this is a perfect means for a Greek overlord to get his multicultural serfs to work properly. We continue to use our own influence to promote this means of communication in the interests of a more efficient realm.
column3: Sur nos terres, un nombre croissant de manants parlent sicilien, ce qui me semble estre un moyen idéal pour un seigneur de faire travailler convenablement ses serfs. Nous continuons à user de notre influence pour promouvoir ce moyen de communication qui contribue à servir les intérests du royaume et à asseoir sa puissance.
column4: Um unser Territorium herum sprechen immer mehr Leute diese sizilianische Sprache. Für einen Oberherrn ist sie meiner Meinung nach ein perfektes Mittel,  Leibeigene zu ordentlicher Arbeit anzuhalten. Zum Zwecke eines effizienteren Reichs werden wir unseren Einfluss weiter zur Förderung dieser Kommunikationsweise einsetzen.
column6: Cada vez hay más gente en nuestras tierras que usan el siciliano, algo que considero perfecto para que un señor haga trabajar adecuadamente a sus siervos. Seguimos fomentando este vehículo de comunicación para que el reino sea más eficiente.

column2: Although every civilised man in Christendom knows that Greek is the true language of communication, this new Sicilian language does have a certain functionality. I have therefore prevailed upon a member of my court to adopt this for everyday administrative use.
column3: Bien que tous les hommes civilisés de la chrétienté sachent que le grec est la vraie langue de la communication, cette nouvelle langue sicilienne s’avère très commode. J’ai donc eu gain de cause sur un membre de ma cour afin qu’elle soit adoptée pour l’emploi administratif quotidien.
column4: Obwohl jeder zivilisierte Mann der Christenheit weiß, dass unsere die einzig wahre Kommunikationsform ist, hat diese neue sizilianische Sprache auch einen gewissen Nutzen. Aus diesem Grund habe ich ein Mitglied meines Hofes dazu gedrängt, sie für das tägliche Verwaltungsgeschäft zu übernehmen.
column6: Aunque todos los hombres civilizados de la cristiandad saben que nos es la verdadera lengua de comunicación, el nuevo idioma siciliano tiene cierta funcionalidad. He convencido a un miembro de mi corte de que lo adopte como lengua administrativa de uso cotidiano.

column2: My Liege has persuded me to embrace this notion of Sicilianness that is sweeping the realm.
column3: Mon suzerain m'a persuadé d'embrasser cette notion de Sicilianité qui déferle sur le Royaume.
column4: My Liege has persuded me to embrace this notion of Sicilianness that is sweeping the realm.
column6: My Liege has persuded me to embrace this notion of Sicilianness that is sweeping the realm.

column2: For as long as have ruled here we Scandinavians have entrusted the raising of our children to Saxon nursemaids. Our first words would not be Scandinavian but Saxon. As we grew up we learned to speak a tongue that was neither one nor the other. Now is this time to make this tongue our own so we may all communicate.
column3: Depuis longtemps, nous confions l'éducation de nos enfants à des nourrices saxonnes. Nos premiers mots ne sont point scandinaves mais saxons. Comme nous avons grandi, nous avons appris à parler une langue qui n'est ni l'une ni l'aultre. Maintenant, est-ce le temps de faire nostre cette langue afin que nous puissions tous communiquer ?
column4: Während meiner gesamten Herrschaft hier haben wir Skandinawier das Aufziehen unserer Kinder sächsischen Kindermädchen anvertraut. Unsere ersten Worte waren kein Skandinawisch, sondern Sächsisch. Beim Heranwachsen lernten wir eine Sprache, die dazwischen lag. Jetzt ist es an der Zeit, uns diese Sprache zu eigen zu machen, damit wir alle kommunizieren können.
column6: For as long as have ruled here we Scandinavians have entrusted the raising of our children to Saxon nursemaids. Our first words would not be Scandinavian but Saxon. As we grew up we learned to speak a tongue that was neither one nor the other. Now is this time to make this tongue our own so we may all communicate.

column2: Around our lands more people are adopting the notion of an Anglo-Norse culture. We continue to use our own influence to promote the blending of cultures.
column3: Autour de nos terres de plus en plus de manants adoptent l'idée d'une culture anglo-scandinave. Nous continuons d'utiliser notre influence pour promouvoir le mélange des cultures.
column4: Rund um unsere Länder nehmen immer mehr Menschen die Vorstellung einer Anglo-Skandinawischer Kultur an. Wir werden weiterhin unsere eigenen Einfluss nutzen, um die Vermischung von Kulturen heranzufördern.
column6: Around our lands more people are adopting the notion of an Anglo-Norse culture. We continue to use our own influence to promote the blending of cultures.

column2: I have persuaded my courtier to embrace the notion of an Anglo-Norse culture that is sweeping across the realm.
column3: J'ai convaincu mon courtisan d'embrasser la notion de culture anglo-scandinave qui déferle sur le royaume.
column4: Ich habe meinen Höfling davon überzeugt dieser Vorstellung von einer Anglo-Skandinavischer Kultur, das sich schon im ganzen Reich kehrt, zu umarmen.
column6: I have persuaded my courtier to embrace the notion of an Anglo-Norse culture that is sweeping across the realm.

column2: My Liege has persuded me to embrace this notion of an Anglo-Norse culture that is sweeping the realm.
column3: Mon suzerain m'a persuadé d'adhérer à cette idée de culture anglo-scandinave qui déferle sur le royaume.
column4: Mein Lehnsherr hat mich davon überzeugt dieser Vorstellung von einem Anglo-Skandinavischer Kultur, das sich schon im ganzen Reich kehrt, zu umarmen.
column6: My Liege has persuded me to embrace this notion of an Anglo-Norse culture that is sweeping the realm.

column2: For as long as we westerners have lived here we have relied upon our Arabic servants and vassals, and our two cultures have blended until we are no longer entirely Latin or Arabic, but something new altogether.
column3: Aussi longtemps que nous ayons vécu ici, nous avons compté sur nos serviteurs et vassaulx arabes. Nos deulx cultures se sont mélangées jusqu'à créer quelque chose de tout à fait nouveau.
column4: Solange wir Lateiner hier gelebt haben, haben wir auf unsere arabischen Diener und Vasallen verlassen, und unsere Kulturen haben sich so vermischt, bis wir nicht mehr ganz Lateinisch oder Arabisch waren, sondern etwas ganz Neues wurde.
column6: For as long as we westerners have lived here we have relied upon our Arabic servants and vassals, and our two cultures have blended until we are no longer entirely Latin or Arabic, but something new altogether.

column2: Yes, let us adopt this new Outremer identity
column3: Oui, unissons nous à nos cerfs.
column4: Ja, lasst uns eins mit unseren Leibeigenen sein.
column6: Yes, let us adopt this new Outremer identity

column4: Mein Lehnsherr hat mich davon überzeugt dieser Vorstellung von einem Latinischer Kultur, das sich schon im ganzen Reich kehrt, zu umarmen.
column6: My Liege has persuaded me to embrace this notion of an Latin culture that is sweeping the realm.

column2: For as long as have ruled here we Scandinavians have entrusted the raising of our children to Celtic nursemaids. Our first words would not be Scandinavian but Celtic. As we grew up we learned to speak a tongue that was neither one nor the other. Now is this time to make this tongue our own so we may all communicate.
column3: Depuis longtemps, nous confions l'éducation de nos enfants à des nourrices Celtes. Nos premiers mots ne sont point scandinaves mais Celtes. Comme nous avons grandi, nous avons appris à parler une langue qui n'est ni l'une ni l'aultre. Maintenant, est-ce le temps de faire nostre cette langue afin que nous puissions tous communiquer ?
column4: Während meiner gesamten Herrschaft hier haben wir Skandinawier das Aufziehen unserer Kinder sächsischen Kindermädchen anvertraut. Unsere ersten Worte waren kein Skandinawisch, sondern Sächsisch. Beim Heranwachsen lernten wir eine Sprache, die dazwischen lag. Jetzt ist es an der Zeit, uns diese Sprache zu eigen zu machen, damit wir alle kommunizieren können.
column6: For as long as have ruled here we Scandinavians have entrusted the raising of our children to Celtic nursemaids. Our first words would not be Scandinavian but Celtic. As we grew up we learned to speak a tongue that was neither one nor the other. Now is this time to make this tongue our own so we may all communicate.

column2: Around our lands more people are adopting the notion of an Gallawa culture. We continue to use our own influence to promote the blending of cultures.
column3: Autour de nos terres de plus en plus de manants adoptent l'idée d'une culture anglo-scandinave. Nous continuons d'utiliser notre influence pour promouvoir le mélange des cultures.
column4: Rund um unsere Länder nehmen immer mehr Menschen die Vorstellung einer Anglo-Skandinawischer Kultur an. Wir werden weiterhin unsere eigenen Einfluss nutzen, um die Vermischung von Kulturen heranzufördern.
column6: Around our lands more people are adopting the notion of an Gallawa culture. We continue to use our own influence to promote the blending of cultures.

column2: I have persuaded my courtier to embrace the notion of an Gallawa culture that is sweeping across the realm.
column3: J'ai convaincu mon courtisan d'embrasser la notion de culture anglo-scandinave qui déferle sur le royaume.
column4: Ich habe meinen Höfling davon überzeugt dieser Vorstellung von einer Anglo-Skandinavischer Kultur, das sich schon im ganzen Reich kehrt, zu umarmen.
column6: I have persuaded my courtier to embrace the notion of an Gallawa culture that is sweeping across the realm.

column2: My Liege has persuaded me to embrace this notion of an Gallawa culture that is sweeping the realm.
column3: Mon suzerain m'a persuadé d'adhérer à cette idée de culture anglo-scandinave qui déferle sur le royaume.
column4: Mein Lehnsherr hat mich davon überzeugt dieser Vorstellung von einem Anglo-Skandinavischer Kultur, das sich schon im ganzen Reich kehrt, zu umarmen.
column6: My Liege has persuded me to embrace this notion of an Gallawa culture that is sweeping the realm.

column2: Long has it been since the Northmen invaded these lands. Some may argue their methods, but no one can deny the effect these people had on the local tribes. As time went on they mingled with the locals to form something entirely new in the process.
column3: Cela fait longtemps que les Nordiques ont envahi ces terres. Certains discutent peult-estre de leur méthode, mais personne ne peult nier l'effet qu'ils ont eu sur les tribus locales. Avec le temps, ils se sont meslés aulx locaulx pour ainsi former quelque chose d'entièrement nouveau.
column4: Long has it been since the Northmen invaded these lands. Some may argue their methods, but no one can deny the effect these people had on the local tribes. As time went on they mingled with the locals to form something entirely new in the process.
column6: Long has it been since the Northmen invaded these lands. Some may argue their methods, but no one can deny the effect these people had on the local tribes. As time went on they mingled with the locals to form something entirely new in the process.

column2: Around our lands more people are using this Russian language and I find this is a perfect means for an overlord to get his serfs to work properly. We continue to use our own influence to promote this means of communication in the interests of more efficient realm.
column3: À travers nos terres, de plus en plus de monde emploie la langue russe et je trouve que c'est le moyen parfait pour un suzerain de mettre ses serfs au labeur comme il faut. Nous continuons à utiliser notre propre influence pour promouvoir ce moyen de communication dans l'intérest d'un royaume plus efficace.
column4: Around our lands more people are using this Russian language and I find this is a perfect means for an overlord to get his serfs to work properly. We continue to use our own influence to promote this means of communication in the interests of more efficient realm.
column6: Around our lands more people are using this Russian language and I find this is a perfect means for an overlord to get his serfs to work properly. We continue to use our own influence to promote this means of communication in the interests of more efficient realm.

column2: Although many dislike change, this new Russian language does have a certain functionality that cannot be denied. I have therefore prevailed upon a member of my court to adopt this for everyday administrative use.
column3: Bien que moults abhorrent le changement, cette nouvelle langue russe possède une certaine fonctionalité qui ne peult estre niée. C'est pourquoi j'ai persuadé un membre de ma cour d'adopter cette langue pour un usage administratif quotidien.
column4: Although many dislike change, this new Russian language does have a certain functionality that cannot be denied. I have therefore prevailed upon a member of my court to adopt this for everyday administrative use.
column6: Although many dislike change, this new Russian language does have a certain functionality that cannot be denied. I have therefore prevailed upon a member of my court to adopt this for everyday administrative use.

column2: I was considering important business when I had an amazing insight. To strengthen my realm I must bring my vassals round to my way of thinking. This involves communication. If I can get them to communicate like me then I will have a much smoother running realm.
column3: Je réfléchissois à une affaire importante lorsque j’ai eu une idée étonnante. Pour renforcer mon Royaume, je dois convertir mes vassaulx à ma façon de penser. Cela passe par la communication. Si je parviens à leur faire adopter mon mode de communication, mon Royaume fonctionnera bien mieulx.
column4: Beim Nachdenken über ein wichtiges Geschäft kam ich zu einer erstaunlichen Einsicht: Zur Stärkung meines Reichs muss ich meine Vasallen von meiner Denkweise überzeugen, und dazu gehört auch die Kommunikation. Wenn ich es schaffen könnte, dass alle wie ich kommunizieren, so wäre mein Reich viel einfacher zu regieren.
column6: Estaba ocupado con asuntos importantes cuando tuve una súbita revelación. Para reforzar mi reino debo lograr que mis vasallos compartan mi forma de pensar. Eso implica comunicación. Si logro que se comuniquen como yo mi reino funcionará mucho mejor.

column2: My liege has persuaded me to embrace this notion of Rus that is sweeping the realm.
column3: Mon suzerain m'a persuadé d'épousailler ce concept de Russiannité qui balaie le royaume.
column4: My liege has persuaded me to embrace this notion of Russianness that is sweeping the realm.
column6: My liege has persuaded me to embrace this notion of Russianness that is sweeping the realm.

column2: Let's go relax in the Banya then, shall we?
column3: Allons nous détendre dans la Banya alors, ok ?
column4: Let's go relax in the Banya then, shall we?
column6: Let's go relax in the Banya then, shall we?

column2: The Jewish Community that I am sheltering has prospered and grown under my benevolent rule.
column3: La communauté juive que je protège a grandi et prospéré sous mon règne bienveillant.
column4: Die Jüdische Gemeinde, die unter Eurem Schutz steht, hat sich entwickelt und wuchs unter Eurer wohlwollenden Herrschaft.
column6: The Jewish Community that I am sheltering has prospered and grown under my benevolent rule.

column2: My liege, I bring news from the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. The Jewish merchants that you wisely allowed to settle in the city have grown fat and prosperous under your benevolent rule, and you can expect increased revenue from the taxes and tariffs imposed on their community.
column3: Mon seigneur, je vous apporte des nouvelles de l'[From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. Les marchands juifs que vous avez sagement autorisés à s'installer dans le bourg se sont developpés et prospèrent sous votre règne bienveillant. Vous pouvez vous attendre à une augmentation des revenus provenant des taxes et droits de douane imposés sur leur communauté.
column4: My liege, I bring news from the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. The Jewish merchants that you wisely allowed to settle in the city have grown fat and prosperous under your benevolent rule, and you can expect increased revenue from the taxes and tariffs imposed on their community.
column6: My liege, I bring news from the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. The Jewish merchants that you wisely allowed to settle in the city have grown fat and prosperous under your benevolent rule, and you can expect increased revenue from the taxes and tariffs imposed on their community.

column2: A skilled advisor from the Jewish Community I am sheltering has made his services available to me.
column3: Un conseiller qualifié de la communauté juive que j'abrite, a mis ses services à ma disposition.
column4: Ein talentierter Berater aus der Jüdischen Gemeinde bietet Euch seine Dienste an.
column6: A skilled advisor from the Jewish Community I am sheltering has made his services available to me.

column2: A group of Jewish refugees from distant lands have come to my court. They are seeking a new a place to live after being expelled from their former homes and ask for my permission to establish a community in one of my cities.
column3: Un groupe de réfugiés juifs d'un pays lointain est venu à ma cour. Ils sont en queste d'un nouveau lieu de vie après avoir été expulsés de leurs anciens foyers et me demandent la permission d'établir une communauté dans un de mes bourgs.
column4: Eine Gruppe jüdischer Flüchtlinge aus fernen Landen kam an euren Hof. Sie sind auf der Suche nach einem neuen Ort zum Leben, nachdem sie aus ihrer Heimat vertrieben wurden. Nun bitten sie um Erlaubnis, sich in einer Eurer Städte niederzulassen und eine neue Gemeinde zu gründen.
column6: A group of Jewish refugees from distant lands have come to my court. They are seeking a new a place to live after being expelled from their former homes and ask for my permission to establish a community in one of my cities.

column2: They are welcome!
column3: Ils sont les bienvenus !
column4: Sie sind willkommen
column6: They are welcome!

column2: Tell them to move on
column3: Dites-leur de partir
column4: Sollen sie weiterziehen
column6: Tell them to move on

column2: [From.GetTitledName] has decreed that all Jews in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are to be expelled from the realm and their assets seized by the crown. This includes my own Jewish subjects, who I have no choice but to banish unless I want to openly defy my liege.
column3: [From.GetTitledName] a décrété que tous les Juifs [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] devaient estre expulsés du royaume et leurs biens saisis par la couronne. Cela comprend mes propres sujets juifs, je n'ai point d'aultre chois que de les bannir à moins que je ne tienne à défier ouvertement mon suzerain.
column4: [From.GetTitledName] hat angeordnet, dass alle Juden aus [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] vertrieben werden sollen und ihr Besitz an die Krone fällt. Das betrifft auch Eure jüdischen Untertanen - und Ihr habt keine andere Wahl, falls Ihr nicht Euren eigenen Besitz verlieren wollt.
column6: [From.GetTitledName] has decreed that all Jews in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are to be expelled from the realm and their assets seized by the crown. This includes my own Jewish subjects, who I have no choice but to banish unless I want to openly defy my liege.

column2: Bow to [From.GetHerHis] demands
column3: Se plier à ses exigences
column4: Beugt Euch [From.GetHerHis]er Forderung
column6: Bow to [From.GetHerHis] demands

column2: Never!
column3: Jamais !
column4: Niemals!
column6: Never!

column2: I have been excommunicated for the sin of dishonorable murder.
column3: J'ai été excommunié pour le péché d'un meurtre déshonorant.
column4: Ich bin für die Sünde des unehrenhaften Mords exkommuniziert worden.
column6: I have been excommunicated for the sin of dishonorable murder.

column2: Being known as a dishonorable murderer is causing me severe mentral stress. Can I really live with what I've done?
column3: Estre connu comme un meurtrier me cause un sévère stress. Puis-je réellement vivre avec ce que j'ai fait ?
column4: Weil bekannt wurde das Ich ein unehrenhafter Mörder bin habe ich Mentale Probleme. Kann ich wirklich damit leben, was ich getan habe?
column6: Being known as a dishonorable murderer is causing me severe mentral stress. Can I really live with what I've done?

column2: The guilt weighs heavily upon me
column3: La culpabilité pèse lourdement sur mes épaules
column4: Die Schuld lastet schwer auf mir
column6: The guilt weighs heavily on me

column2: I'm handling it just fine
column3: Je me remets, tout va bien
column4: Ich mache mich ganz gut
column6: I'm handling it just fine

column2: I have no regrets
column3: Je n'ai nul regret
column4: Ich hege keine Reue
column6: I have no regrets

column2: I was listening in on my courtiers' conversation when I heard one of them call me a murderer. They are clearly working with my enemies!
column3: J'écoutois discrètement la conversation de mes courtisans lorsque j'ai ouï l'un d'eulx me désigner comme un meurtrier. Il est clair qu'il travaillent pour mes ennemis !
column4: Ich hörte in einem Gespräch meiner Höflinge, das mich einer einen Mörder nannte. Sie arbeiten klar mit meinen Feinden!
column6: I was listening in on my courtiers' conversation when I heard one of them call me a murderer. They are clearly working with my enemies!

column2: They must die! They must all die!
column3: Ils doivent mourir ! Ils doivent tous mourir !
column4: Sie müssen sterben, alle müssen sie sterben !
column6: They must die! They must all die!

column2: Your fallen enemy lies before you, he was a valiant foe and his head will make a great trophy to prove your valor to the gods. Grasping your blade firmly, you sever his head from the rest of his body.
column3: Votre ennemi vaincu gist devant vous, c'estoit un adversaire valeureulx et sa teste fera un superbe trophée pour prouver votre valeur aulx dieulx. Tenant fermement votre lame, vous tranchez sa teste du reste de son corps.
column4: Your fallen enemy lies before you, he was a valiant foe and his head will make a great trophy to prove your valor to the gods. Grasping your blade firmly, you sever his head from the rest of his body.
column6: Your fallen enemy lies before you, he was a valiant foe and his head will make a great trophy to prove your valor to the gods. Grasping your blade firmly, you sever his head from the rest of his body.

column2: For [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
column3: Pour [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] !
column4: For [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
column6: For [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!

column2: The gods must favor you, for again you are blessed with victory! As you sever your foe's head from the rest of his body, you hear a bard singing the song of Cu Chullain.
column3: Vous devez avoir les faveurs des dieulx, car vous estes une nouvelle fois béni par une victoire ! Alors que vous tranchez la teste de votre ennemi du reste de son corps, vous oyez un barde chanter la chanson de Cu Chullain.
column4: The gods must favor you, for again you are blessed with victory! As you sever your foe's head from the rest of his body, you hear a bard singing the song of Cu Chullain.
column6: The gods must favor you, for again you are blessed with victory! As you sever your foe's head from the rest of his body, you hear a bard singing the song of Cu Chullain.

column2: He will have a new hero to sing about now!
column3: Il aura un nouvel héros au sujet duquel chanter désormais !
column4: He will have a new hero to sing about now!
column6: He will have a new hero to sing about now!

column2: I have served my liege loyally. Perhaps I should try to make friends with [Root.Liege.GetHerHim].
column3: J'ai servi loyalement mon suzerain. Peult-estre devrois-je essayer de me lier d'amitié avec lui.
column4: I have served my liege loyally.  Perhaps I should try to make friends with him.
column6: I have served my liege loyally.  Perhaps I should try to make friends with him.

column2: Let's try.
column3: Essayons
column4: Let's try.
column6: Let's try.

column2: Maybe later...
column3: Peult-estre plus tard...
column4: Maybe later...
column6: Maybe later...

column2: My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], approached me after a council meeting today and asking me to join [From.GetHerHim] for supper. We both had a grand time, and I think perhaps I should continue to spend time with [From.GetFirstName].
column3: Mon [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], m'a approché après une rencontre le jour d'hui et m'a demandé d'aller disner avec [From.GetHerHim]. Nous avons tous les deulx passé un très bon moment, et je songe que je ferois peult-estre bien de continuer à passer du temps avec [From.GetFirstName].
column4: My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], approached me after a meeting today and asking me to join [From.GetHerHim] for supper.  We both had a grand time, and I think perhaps I should continue to spend time with [From.GetFirstName].
column6: My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], approached me after a meeting today and asking me to join [From.GetHerHim] for supper.  We both had a grand time, and I think perhaps I should continue to spend time with [From.GetFirstName].

column2: Let's be friends, [From.GetFirstName].
column3: Soyons amis, [From.GetFirstName].
column4: Let's be friends, [From.GetFirstName].
column6: Let's be friends, [From.GetFirstName].

column2: [This.GetTitle]s have no friends. Only subjects and enemies!
column3: Les [This.GetTitle]s n'ont point d'amis. Seulement des sujets et des ennemis !
column4: [This.GetTitle]s have no friends.  Only subjects and enemies!
column6: [This.GetTitle]s have no friends.  Only subjects and enemies!

column2: I dined with my liege and now the two of us have agreed to go meet again within the fortnight. I think this is the beginning to a beautiful friendship!
column3: J'ai disné avec mon suzerain et nous avons tous deulx convenu d'aller chasser ensemble sous quinzaine. Je songe que c'est le début d'une belle amitié !
column4: I dined with my liege and now the two of us have agreed to go hunting together within the fortnight.  I think this is the beginning to a beautiful friendship!
column6: I dined with my liege and now the two of us have agreed to go hunting together within the fortnight.  I think this is the beginning to a beautiful friendship!

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] and I had a great time at supper, but [From.GetSheHe] refused my kind offer to meet again. Perhaps another time...
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] et moi avons passé un très bon moment au disner, mais [From.GetSheHe] a refusé mon aimable proposition d'aller chasser ensemble. peult-estre une aultre fois...
column4: [From.GetTitledFirstName] and I had a great time at supper, but [From.GetSheHe] refused my kind offer to go hunting together.  Perhaps another time...
column6: [From.GetTitledFirstName] and I had a great time at supper, but [From.GetSheHe] refused my kind offer to go hunting together.  Perhaps another time...

column2: I feel the need to talk to someone. Perhaps one of my courtiers will entertain me.
column3: Je ressens le besoin de parler à quelqu'un. Peult-estre qu'un de mes courtiers saura me divertir.
column4: I feel the need to talk to someone.  Perhaps one of my courtiers will entertain me.
column6: I feel the need to talk to someone.  Perhaps one of my courtiers will entertain me.

column2: Let's see what they have to say.
column3: Voyons ce qu'ils ont à dire.
column4: Let's see what they have to say.
column6: Let's see what they have to say.

column2: I'm not interested in these people.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] came by to talk with me today. We discussed many interesting subjects and [From.GetSheHe] seemed quite pleased. [From.GetSheHe] suggested that perhaps we should meet for a bottle of wine sometime.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] est venu discuter avec moi le jour d'hui. Nous avons abordé moults sujets intéressants et [From.GetFirstName] a semblé plutost content. [From.GetSheHe] a suggéré que nous devrions peult-estre nous revoir autour d'une bouteille de vin un de ces jours.

column2: I was sitting alone when [From.GetTitledFirstName] asked me if I wanted to spar with [From.GetHerHim]. I had a lot of fun... perhaps I should consider training with [From.GetHerHim] more often?

column4: I was sitting alone when [From.GetTitledFirstName] asked me if I wanted to spar with him.  I had a lot of fun, but [From.GetFirstName] bested me in most of our bouts.  I should ask him to help me train!

column2: Sieges could drag on for months and even years, and the besieging troops had to forage the countryside for supplies. These foraging parties could sometimes devolve into looting and outright vandalism. This was the case in [Root.Location.GetName], where our troops have have pillaged and torched one of the province's buildings.
column3: Les sièges pouvoient se prolonger pendant des mois, voire des années, et les troupes qui assiégeoient avoient besoin de vivres pour s'approvisionner. Ces questes de victuailles pouvoient parfois se transformer en pillage et en vandalisme pur et simple. Ce fut le cas en [Root.Location.GetName], où nos troupes ont pillé et incendié l'un des bastiments de la province.
column4: Belagerungen konnten sich über Monate und sogar Jahre hinziehen, und die belagernden Truppen mussten sich aus der Umgebung selbst versorgen. Diese Suche führte manchmal auch zu Plünderungen und Vandalismus. Dies war der Fall in [Root.Location.GetName], wo unsere Truppen geplündert und ein Gebäude in Brand gesteckt haben.
column6: Sieges could drag on for months and even years, and the besieging troops had to forage the countryside for supplies. These foraging parties could sometimes devolve into looting and outright vandalism. This was the case in [Root.Location.GetName], where our troops have have pillaged and torched one of the province's buildings.

column2:
1) Move your marshal to any province (any job action will do) and use the 'Raise Banner in X' decision to flag holdings in that province as ones you want to keep. You can use the 'Lower Banner in X' decision to unflag provinces.

2) Use either the 'Distribute All Barony Tier Holdings' or 'Distribute All Holdings' decision to hand out all non-flagged titles to random rulers.

3) Use the 'End Distribution of Titles' decision to clear the other decisions from your list and to remove all existing flags.
