column2: Just give me a rope...
column3: Donnez-moi seulement une corde...
column4: Just give me a rope...
column6: Just give me a rope...

column2: I think it's better we wait
column3: Je crois que le mieulx est d'attendre.
column4: I think it's better we wait.
column6: I think it's better we wait.

column2: Just as I thought I had made it to freedom, a group of armed men appear under the banner of my foe.  Exhausted from my escape, it is all I can do to croak the word 'yield.'
column3: Alors que je songeois avoir réussi à recouvrer ma liberté, un groupe d'hommes armés apparoist, portant l'étendard de mon ennemi. Exténué par mon évasion, tout ce que je puis faire est de lascher d'une voix rauque Je me rends.
column4: Just as I thought I had made it to freedom, a group of armed men appear under the banner of my foe.  Exhausted from my escape, it is all I can do to croak the word 'yield.'
column6: Just as I thought I had made it to freedom, a group of armed men appear under the banner of my foe.  Exhausted from my escape, it is all I can do to croak the word 'yield.'

column2: In the dead of night, as a low mist hung about the curtain wall, you creep out a postern door and float across the moat on an inflated sheepskin.  It's only by the ineptitude of the enemy watch that you stagger, dripping wet, through the siege lines and to the safety of a nearby wood.  Thanks be to God! ... Although any family left behind is likely angry with us...
column3: Au milieu de la nuitée, tandis que la brume envahit les murs extérieurs, vous vous faufilez à travers une poterne et traversez les douves sur une peau de mouton gonflée d'air. Ce n'est que grasce au manque de vigilance des gardes ennemis que vous réussissez à franchir, trempé jusqu'aulx os, les lignes de siège et gagnez la sécurité du bois voisin. Dieu soit loué ! ... Bien que tout membre de ma famille laissé derrière moi sera probablement courroucé envers moi...
column4: In the dead of night, as a low mist hung about the curtain wall, you creep out a postern door and float across the moat on an inflated sheepskin.  It's only by the ineptitude of the enemy watch that you stagger, dripping wet, through the siege lines and to the safety of a nearby wood.  Thanks be to God! ... Although any family left behind is likely angry with us...
column6: In the dead of night, as a low mist hung about the curtain wall, you creep out a postern door and float across the moat on an inflated sheepskin.  It's only by the ineptitude of the enemy watch that you stagger, dripping wet, through the siege lines and to the safety of a nearby wood.  Thanks be to God! ... Although any family left behind is likely angry with us...

column2: Your steward leads you down into the store rooms to a passage you didn't even know existed.  Beyond it, a dismal tunnel full of death and decay, and you are only too glad to reach the moat and relatively fresh water. I hope I never have to do that again!  It only now occurs to me that any family left behind is likely angry with me for leaving them in the hands of the enemy.
column3: Votre chancelier vous guide à travers les salles de stockage dans un chemin dont vous ne soupçonniez mesme point l'existence. Au bout, un sombre tunnel qui puire la mort et la décomposition, et vous n'estes que trop heureulx d'atteindre les douves et son eau relativement fraische. J'espère que je n'auroi plus jamais à faire ça ! Ce n'est qu'alors que je réalise que les membres de ma famille que j'ai pu laisser derrière moi vont prob1ablement estre courroucés que je les aie abandonnés entre les mains de l'ennemi.
column4: Your steward leads you down into the store rooms to a passage you didn't even know existed.  Beyond it, a dismal tunnel full of death and decay, and you are only too glad to reach the moat and relatively fresh water. I hope I never have to do that again!  It only now occurs to me that any family left behind is likely angry with me for leaving them in the hands of the enemy.
column6: Your steward leads you down into the store rooms to a passage you didn't even know existed.  Beyond it, a dismal tunnel full of death and decay, and you are only too glad to reach the moat and relatively fresh water. I hope I never have to do that again!  It only now occurs to me that any family left behind is likely angry with me for leaving them in the hands of the enemy.

column2: They said only a lunatic would attempt climbing down the southeast wall, and certainly the enemy agreed!  A near thing, too, when my foot slipped on that patch of moss.  My brush with death over with, and safety assured, it only now occurs to me that any family left behind will see this as a desertion, not a bold deed of heroism...
column3: Ils disoient que seul un fol essaieroit de descendre le mur du sud-est, et l'ennemi devoit susrement estre d'accord ! C'est vrai que ce n'est point passé loin, quand mon pied a glissé sur cette touffe de mousse. Ma danse avec la mort une fois terminée, et ma sécurité assurée, ce n'est qu'alors que je réalise que tout membre de ma famille que j'ai pu laisser derrière verra susrement mon acte comme une désertion, et non comme un exploit audacieulx et héroïque...
column4: They said only a lunatic would attempt climbing down the southeast wall, and certainly the enemy agreed!  A near thing, too, when my foot slipped on that patch of moss. column2: My [Root.GetLordLady] [Root.GetFirstName],\nIt is my position that the Carolingian Empire is a legacy deserving of the likes of Charlemagne, and requires a ruler of sufficient substance and character to earn its support. I believe that ruler is not you, and thus the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] hereby declares its independence from the empire. We will find our own way from this day on.\n[From.GetTitledName]

column2: To the most devout and serene [Root.GetTitledFirstName],\nIn the name of the Lord, I, [From.GetTitledName], agree to offer my blessing and will anoint you as Holy Roman Emperor. May your rule be both just and eternal.

column2: 'In the name of Christ, I, [From.GetTitledFirstName], promise, pledge and guarantee in the sight of God and the blessed Apostle Peter that I will be the protector and defender of this holy Roman Church in all ways useful to her, however many, in so far as I am supported by divine assistance according to my knowledge and ability.'\n\nToday [From.GetTitledFirstName] was crowned by his Holiness the Pope and formally received the title of Holy Roman Emperor and the Imperial Regalia with the blessing of the Pope.
column3: 'Au Nom du Christ, Nous, [From.GetTitledFirstName], promettons, nous engageons et jurons devant Dieu et le bienheureulx Apostre Pierre que Nous serons le protecteur et le défenseur de la très-sainte Eglise Romaine, que Nous la servirons en toutes occasions, ou au moins dans moultes, dans la mesure où Nous sommes soutenus par la divine assistance et en accord avec nos propres connaissances et capacités.'\n\nAujourd'hui [From.GetTitledFirstName] a été couronné par Sa Sainteté le Pape et a formellement reçu le titre de Saint Empereur Romain et les Regalia Impériaulx avec la bénédiction du Pape.
column4: 'Im Namen Christi, Ich, [From.GetTitledFirstName], Unterpfand und Garant in den Augen Gottes und der seligen Apostel Petrus, verspreche, dass ich der Beschützer und Verteidiger dieser heiligen römischen Kirche mit allen erforderlichen Mitteln sein werde.'\n\n Heute wurde [From.GetTitledFirstName] von Seiner Heiligkeit dem Papst gekrönt und erhielt offiziell den Titel Kaiser und die Reichskleinodien mit dem Segen des Papstes.
column6: 'In the name of Christ, I, [From.GetTitledFirstName], promise, pledge and guarantee in the sight of God and the blessed Apostle Peter that I will be the protector and defender of this holy Roman Church in all ways useful to her, however many, in so far as I am supported by divine assistance according to my knowledge and ability.'\n\nToday [From.GetTitledFirstName] was crowned by his Holiness the Pope and formally received the title of Holy Roman Emperor and the Imperial Regalia with the blessing of the Pope.

column2: The throne of the Carolingian Empire is not an easy thing to hold. Its vassals are notoriously independent, and as each generation of rulers gets further from Charlemagne, their memory of what the throne stands for growns more distant. For now, at least, your rule appears to be safe.

column2: Though you recently assumed the Carolingian throne, it appears it is not yours to hold. The Pope has refused to anoint you with his blessing, and indeed there are far too many who consider the throne to exist only in name. To them, you claim of the imperial title is meaningless. The once-great empire of Charlemagne has fallen to chaos.

column2: I expressed my wishes and desires for a coronation in Rome to his holiness the Pope. Hopefully he will accept my request so that I can begin inviting my lords to attend the coronation ceremony.
column3: J'ai exprimé mon souhait et mon désir d'estre couronné à Rome par Sa Sainteté le Pape. Avec bon espoir il accèdera à ma requeste et je pourrois commencer à inviter mes seigneurs pour qu'ils assistent au couronnement.
column4: Ich äußerte meine Wünsche und Sehnsüchte für eine Krönung in Rom, um seine Heiligkeit der Papst. Hoffentlich wird er akzeptieren meine Bitte, damit ich anfangen kann meine Herren einladen, um die Krönungszeremonie beizuwohnen.
column6: I expressed my wishes and desires for a coronation in Rome to his holiness the Pope. Hopefully he will accept my request so that I can begin inviting my lords to attend the coronation ceremony.

column2: Of course he will accept

column2:
To the most Reverend and Blessed Apostolic Pope,

I would like to ask you for your blessing in my rule as Emperor-elect by holding officially holding a coronation ceremony in my honour.

Your most devoted subject,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
Au Vénérable et Bienheureulx Pape Apostolique,

J'aimerois vous demander votre bénédiction pour mon règne en tant qu'Empereur-élu par la tenue d'une cérémonie de couronnement en mon honneur.

Votre sujet le plus dévoué,
[From.GetTitledName]
column4:
Zu den vererten und seligen Apostolischen Papst, würde 

l nich möchte Ihnen für Ihren Segen bitten werdet in meinem Herrschaft als Kaiser-elect, indem offiziell im Besitz einer Krönungszeremonie in meiner Ehre. 

 Euer ergebener Diener
column6:
To the most Reverend and Blessed Apostolic Pope,

I would like to ask you for your blessing in my rule as Emperor-elect by holding officially holding a coronation ceremony in my honour.

Your most devoted subject,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2: To the most devout and serene [Root.GetTitledFirstName],\nIn the name of the Lord, I, [From.GetTitledName], would like to offer you my blessing to allow your coronation in Rome, as [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor, under my guidance.
column3: Au Pieulx et Sérénissime [Root.GetTitledFirstName],\nAu nom de Notre Seigneur, moi, [From.GetTitledName], voudrais vous offrir ma bénédiction pour votre couronnement à Rome, comme [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Empereur, par moi conseillé.
column4: An den frommen und heitern [Root.GetTitledFirstName], \nIm Namen des Herrn, Ich, [From.GetTitledName], möchte Euch meinen Segen anbieten und Eure Krönung in Rom ermöglichen, als [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Kaiser.
column6: To the most devout and serene [Root.GetTitledFirstName],\nIn the name of the Lord, I, [From.GetTitledName], would like to offer you my blessing to allow your coronation in Rome, as [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor, under my guidance.

column6: Excellent, send out the a message to invite all my lords

column2:
To [Root.GetHerHisCap] Majesty [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
In the name of the Lord, I, [From.GetTitledName], would like to inform you that I deem you are not yet worthy and just enough as a ruler to be offered my blessings to become crowned as the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor. The Lord surely has much faith in you as you have in him, but remember that the honour of receiving His blessing does not come easy and is only for the purest of souls.
Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
A Sa Majesté [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
Au nom de Notre Seigneur, Nous, [From.GetTitledName], voudrions vous informer que nous ne vous jugeons point encor assez digne et juste comme souverain pour vous octroyer notre bénédiction en tant que [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Empereur couronné. Le Seigneur à susrement plus de foi en vous que vous en Lui, mais n'oubliez point que l'honneur de recevoir Sa Bénédiction n'est point chose aisée et est réservé aulx plus pures des asmes.
Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
column4:
An seine Majestät [Root.GetTitledFirstName], 
 Im Namen des Herrn, Wir, [From.GetTitledName], möchten Euch mitteilen, dass Wir Weuch noch nicht für würdig genug befinden, um meinen Segen und die Reichskrone der [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Kaiser zu emfangen. Der Herr hat sicher viel Vertrauen in Euch, wie Ihr zu ihm. Aber denkt daran, dass die Ehre der Reichskrone zur dem zuteil wird, der die reinste Seele in Seien Augen vorweist. 
 gezeichnet, 
 [From.GetTitledName]
column6:
To his Majesty [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
In the name of the Lord, I, [From.GetTitledName], would like to inform you that I deem you are not yet worthy and just enough as a ruler to be offered my blessings to become crowned as the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor. The Lord surely has much faith in you as you have in him, but remember that the honour of receiving His blessing does not come easy and is only for the purest of souls.
Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2: Why can't he ever just say:No!
column3: Pourquoi ne peult-il jamais se contenter de répondre: Non!
column4: Wie konnte er nur NEIN sagen!
column6: Why can't he ever just say:No!

column2:
To Noble [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
You should be happy to know that, I, [From.GetTitledName], will hold a coronation ceremony in Rome in my honour with the blessing of his Holiness the Pope. You received the honour to be invited to attend the ceremony, which will be held soon in Rome. I await your postive reply.

Your most Holy Lord and Liege,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
Au Noble [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
Vous devriez estre heureulx d'apprendre que moi, [From.GetTitledName], vais organiser une cérémonie de couronnement à Rome en mon honneur avec la bénédiction de Sa Sainteté le pape. Vous avez l'honneur d'estre invité pour assister à la cérémonie, qui devroit avoir lieu sous peu à Rome. J'attends votre réponse positive.

Votre Très Saint Seigneur et Suzerain,
[From.GetTitledName]
column4:
An den edlen [Root.GetTitledFirstName], 
 Ihr sollet froh sein, zu wissen,dass ich, [From.GetTitledName], eine Krönungszeremonie in Rom zu meinen Ehren halten werde, mit dem Segen Seiner Heiligkeit des Papstes. Ihr erhaltet die Ehre, zu dieser Zeremonie, die in Kürze in Rom stattfinden soll, eingeladen zu werden. Ich erwarte Eure positive Antwort. 

Neuer allerheiligster Herr, 
[From.GetTitledName]
column6:
To Noble [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
You should be happy to know that, I, [From.GetTitledName], will hold a coronation ceremony in Rome in my honour with the blessing of his Holiness the Pope. You received the honour to be invited to attend the ceremony, which will be held soon in Rome. I await your postive reply.

Your most Holy Lord and Liege,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2: I will attend the ceremony
column3: J'assisterois à la cérémonie.
column4: Ich werde ihm schreiben, dass ich teilnehme
column6: I will attend the ceremony

column2: I refuse to set foot in that pompous windbag's castle
column3: Je refuse de mettre un pied dans ce castel de pompeuses baudruches.
column4: Ich weigere mich, je einen Fuß in jenes pompösen Windbeutels Schloss zu setzen
column6: I refuse to set foot in that pompous windbag's castle

column2: [From.GetTitledName] is sorry to inform you that [From.GetSheHe] will not be able to attend the coronation ceremony in Rome as [From.GetSheHe] has more important issues to attend to.
column3: [From.GetTitledName] est désolé de vous informer qu'il ne pourra point assister à la cérémonie de couronnement à Rome car il a des choses plus importantes à faire.
column4: [From.GetTitledName] bedauert, Euch mitzuteilen, dass er nicht in der Lage ist, die Krönungszeremonie in Rom zu besuchen, da er wichtigere Dinge zu erledigen hat.
column6: [From.GetTitledName] is sorry to inform you that [From.GetSheHe] will not be able to attend the coronation ceremony in Rome as [From.GetSheHe] has more important issues to attend to.

column2: I have no words for such dishonor
column3: Je n'ai point de mot pour un tel déshonneur.
column4: Ich habe keine Worte für solche Unehre
column6: I have no words for such dishonour

column2: Today I was crowned by his Holiness the Pope and formally received the title of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor and the Imperial Regalia with the blessing of the Pope.
column3: Aujourd'hui j'ai été couronné par Sa Sainteté le Pape et ai formellement reçu le titre de [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Empereur et les Regalia Impériaulx avec la bénédiction du Pape.
column4: Heute wurde ich von Seiner Heiligkeit dem Papst gekrönt und erhielt offiziell den Titel Kaiser und die Reichskleinodien mit dem Segen des Papstes.
column6: Today I was crowned by his Holiness the Pope and formally received the title of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor and the Imperial Regalia with the blessing of the Pope.

column3: [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Empereur
column4: [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Kaiser
column6: [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor

column2: This will strengthen my rule significantly
column3: Cela va grandement renforcer mon autorité.
column4: Dies wird meine Herschaft deutlich stärken
column6: This will strengthen my rule significantly

column2: Today [From.GetTitledFirstName] was crowned by his Holiness the Pope and formally received the title of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor and the Imperial Regalia with the blessing of the Pope. The ceremony was magnificent.
column3: Aujourd'hui [From.GetTitledFirstName] a été couronné par Sa Sainteté le Pape et a formellement reçu le titre de [From.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Empereur avec la bénédiction du Pape. La cérémonie estoit grandiose.
column4: Heute wurde [From.GetTitledFirstName] von Seiner Heiligkeit dem Papst gekrönt und erhielt offiziell den Titel Kaiser und die Reichskleinodien mit dem Segen des Papstes. Die Zeremonie war großartig.
column6: Today [From.GetTitledFirstName] was crowned by his Holiness the Pope and formally received the title of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor and the Imperial Regalia with the blessing of the Pope. The ceremony was magnificent.

column2: Long may [From.GetTitledFirstName] live!
column3: Longue vie au(à la) [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
column4: Lang lebe [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
column6: Long may [From.GetTitledFirstName] live!

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been crowned and received the Imperial Regalia by his holiness the Pope in the St. Peter's Basilica in Rome. The divine blessings conveyed by his Holiness the Pope confirm the right of rule over all Imperial lands governed by [From.GetTitledFirstName] and his appointed vassals.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] a été couronné et a reçu les regalia Impériaulx par Sa Sainteté le Pape en la Sainte Basilique de Rome. Les bénédictions divines transmisent par Sa Sainteté le Pape confirme son droit de régner sur toutes les terres Impériales gouvernées [From.GetTitledFirstName] et ses vassaulx fieffés.
column4: [From.GetTitledFirstName] wurde gekrönt und erhielt die Reichskleinodien von Seiner Heiligkeit dem Papst in der Basilika St. in Rom. Der göttliche Segen, vermittelt durch seine Heiligkeit den Papst, bestätigt das Recht, über alle kaiserlichen Ländereien von [From.GetTitledFirstName] und seine Vasallen zu herrschen.
column6: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been crowned and received the Imperial Regalia by his holiness the Pope in the St. Basilica in Rome. The divine blessings conveyed by his Holiness the Pope confirm the right of rule over all Imperial lands governed by [From.GetTitledFirstName] and his appointed vassals.

column2: Ok
column3: Ok
column4: Ok
column6: Ok

column2: 'In the name of Christ, I, [Root.GetTitledFirstName], promise, pledge and guarantee in the sight of God and the blessed Apostle Peter that I will be the protector and defender of this holy Roman Church in all ways useful to her, however many, in so far as I am supported by divine assistance according to my knowledge and ability.'\n\nToday [Root.GetTitledFirstName] was crowned by his Holiness the Pope and formally received the title of Holy Roman Emperor and the Imperial Regalia with the blessing of the Pope.
column3: 'Au Nom du Christ, Nous, [Root.GetTitledFirstName], promettons, nous engageons et jurons devant Dieu et le bienheureulx Apostre Pierre que Nous serons le protecteur et le défenseur de la très-sainte Eglise Romaine, que Nous la servirons en toutes occasions, ou au moins dans moultes, dans la mesure où Nous sommes soutenus par la divine assistance et en accord avec nos propres connaissances et capacités.'\n\nAujourd'hui [Root.GetTitledFirstName] a été couronné par Sa Sainteté le Pape et a formellement reçu le titre de Saint Empereur Romain et les Regalia Impériaulx avec la bénédiction du Pape.
column4: 'Im Namen Christi, Ich, [Root.GetTitledFirstName], Unterpfand und Garant in den Augen Gottes und der seligen Apostel Petrus, verspreche, dass ich der Beschützer und Verteidiger dieser heiligen römischen Kirche mit allen erforderlichen Mitteln sein werde.'\n\n Heute wurde [Root.GetTitledFirstName] von Seiner Heiligkeit dem Papst gekrönt und erhielt offiziell den Titel Kaiser und die Reichskleinodien mit dem Segen des Papstes.
column6: 'In the name of Christ, I, [Root.GetTitledFirstName], promise, pledge and guarantee in the sight of God and the blessed Apostle Peter that I will be the protector and defender of this holy Roman Church in all ways useful to her, however many, in so far as I am supported by divine assistance according to my knowledge and ability.'\n\nToday [Root.GetTitledFirstName] was crowned by his Holiness the Pope and formally received the title of Holy Roman Emperor and the Imperial Regalia with the blessing of the Pope.

column2: With Lotharingia and Burgundy having fallen under my domain, my relatives are crying foul. They are demanding to meet with me at Meerssen, to create a new treaty to replace the Treaty of Verdun which first split up the Frankish Empire. If I do not, there will be no peace.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has met with his vassals at Meerssen and come up with a new treaty following his inheritance of Lotharingia and Burgundy. This will more equitably split the lands of Lothaire among his heirs, and allow for peace—at least for a time.

My [Root.GetLordLady],
Sadly, the untimely death of [From.GetTitledName] obviously means that [From.GetHerHis] coronation must hereby be canceled. We regret the inconvenience.

Signed,
The Chancellor of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]

column2: 'I, [From.GetFirstName] of the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty, and with the blessing of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap], do hereby rightfully assume the crown of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].'\n\nWith those words does [From.GetSheHe] become [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in truth, with each of [From.GetHerHis] vassals lining up to bow before [From.GetHerHim] and swear everlasting fealty. It is an impressive ceremony, full of pomp and circumstance, and one that will write [From.GetTitledFirstName] into history. The streets of [From.Capital.GetName] are lined with [From.Capital.Culture.GetName] crowds cheering, with everyone straining to get a look at the important personages that pass by on their way to the forthcoming feast.

column2: For most of the coronation feast, [From.GetTitledName] acted normally...or as normally as one can expect [From.GetHerHim] to be, perhaps. column2: With [Root.GetTitledFirstName] sitting upon its throne in [Root.Capital.GetName], the Byzantine Empire is still flourishing and has only just begun to show signs of decadence. With the grace of God, [Root.GetSheHe] will be able to maintain its might and perhaps even restore the Roman Empire to its proper place in the civilized world once more.

column2: With [Root.GetTitledFirstName] currently sitting upon its throne in [Root.Capital.GetName], the Byzantine Empire is beginning to crack at the seams. Too many wars that should have been won have instead been lost through mismanagement and decadence, and there are those who say its time is nearing an end. With the grace of God, the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] will be able to reverse this trend and resture the might of the Roman Empire that once was.

column2: With [Root.GetTitledFirstName] currently sitting upon its throne in [Root.Capital.GetName], the Byzantine Empire is in a state of chaos. War after war against the infidels has been lost, and there are those who say it would take the grace of God Himself for the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] to shrug off the decadence of [Root.GetHerHis] court and restore what once was. The might of the Roman Empire of old seems but a distant dream.

column2: With [Root.GetTitledFirstName] currently sitting upon its throne in [Root.Capital.GetName], the once-mighty Byzantine Empire is a shadow of its former grace. The court of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] has become decadent and corrupt, and there are many who question the possibility of the empire's mere survival, never mind dream of restoring the Roman Empire that once was. We pray for the grace of God to be bestowed upon the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] in this, our empire's hour of greatest need.

column4: The Byzantine Collapse
column6: The Byzantine Collapse

column2: The Eastern Roman Empire has resisted the slow decay and corruption of its power throughout the Dark Ages, but now it seems entropy has finally taken its toll. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] watches from [Root.GetHerHis] throne in [Root.Capital.GetName] as all of Anatolia slips from the empire's grasp, a sure sign of just how far it has fallen from grace. Many within the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]'s court are already questioning whether it is even possible for the empire to survive the coming days. Whatever the truth, it will take the grace of God Himself to see [Root.GetTitledFirstName] through these dark days.

column2: With the eastern provinces in Armenia having been conquered by the Seljuks, the authority of the Byzantine Empire over all of Asia Minor has rapidly begun to crumble. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] watches helplessly from [Root.GetHerHis] throne in [Root.Capital.GetName] as a muslim warlord establishes the so-called 'Sultanate of Rûm' in lands that were, until recently, rightfully [Root.GetHersHis]. Whether the empire will be able to recover from this crippling blow remains to be seen, but all of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]'s court fervently prays for the grace of God to shine on [Root.GetHerHim] in this, [Root.GetHerHis] darkest hour.

[From.GetTitledName]

column2: The ceremonies are in full swing and the fate of [From.GetTitledFirstName] is being determined - will [From.GetSheHe] continue the inevitable decay of the Roman Empire, or will [From.GetSheHe] stop its advance? It is for you to decide.

column2: Emperor of the Romans
column3: Empereur des Romains

column2: For centuries the magnificent Constantinople, Queen of the Cities, was a capital of the Eastern Roman Empire. Today this glorious city is full of joy - a new ruler ascends to the throne and a magnificent coronation takes place in the Hagia Sophia.\n\n'In the name of Iesous Christos Pantocrator, Lord of the Kosmos, I, [Root.GetFirstName], accept the Imperial Crown from the hands of [From.GetFirstName], Patriarch of Konstantinoupolis, and solemnly swear before the Senate and People of Rome as your [Root.GetTitle] to rule with justness, fairness and divine guidance, to protect this Holy Church form all evil and, by the grace of our Savior, to never let the light of our True Faith and this Basileia Rhomaion to dim. So help me God!'
column3: Depuis des siècles, la magnifique Constantinople, Reine des Villes, était la capitale de l'Empire romain d'Orient.  Aujourd'hui cette glorieuse cité est emplie de joie - un nouveau dirigeant monte sur le trône et un magnifique couronnement à lieu en Sainte Spohie. Au nom de Iesous Christos Pantocrator, Seigneur des Cieux, Moi, [Root.GetFirstName], accepte la couronne impériale des mains de [From.GetFirstName], Patriarche de Contantinople, et je jure solennellement devant le Sénat et le peuple de Rome qu'en tant que votre [Root.GetTitle] de régner avec justice, équité et direction divine, pour protéger la Sainte Église contre toute forme de mal et, par la grâce de notre Sauveur, de ne jamais abandonner la lumière de notre vraie foi et de l'Empire Romain. Que Dieu me vienne en aide !
column4: For centuries the magnificent Constantinople, Queen of the Cities, was a capital of the Eastern Roman Empire. Today this glorious city is full of joy - a new ruler ascends to the throne and a magnificent coronation takes place in the Hagia Sophia.\n\n'In the name of Iesous Christos Pantocrator, Lord of the Kosmos, I, [Root.GetFirstName], accept the Imperial Crown from the hands of [From.GetFirstName], Patriarch of Konstantinoupolis, and solemnly swear before the Senate and People of Rome as your [Root.GetTitle] to rule with justness, fairness and divine guidance, to protect this Holy Church form all evil and, by the grace of our Savior, to never let the light of our True Faith and this Basileia Rhomaion to dim. So help me God!'

So help me God!'

column2: 'In the name of Iesous Christos Pantocrator, Lord of the Kosmos, I, [Root.GetFirstName], accept the Imperial Crown from the hands of [FromFrom.GetFirstName], Patriarch of Konstantinoupolis, and solemnly swear before the Senate and People of Rome as your [Root.GetTitle] to rule with justness, fairness and divine guidance, to protect this Holy Church form all evil and, by the grace of our Savior, to never let the light of our True Faith and this Basileia Rhomaion to dim. So help me God!'\n\nWith those words does [From.GetSheHe] become [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in truth, with each of [From.GetHerHis] vassals lining up to bow before [From.GetHerHim] and swear everlasting fealty. It is an impressive ceremony, full of pomp and circumstance...though there is a lingering feeling among those present that they are witnessing not a resurgence of the empire's greatness, but simply one more step in its inevitable decline.

column2:
My liege,
Naturally it is in all our best interests to ensure there is a smooth transition between your rule and that of [liege_heir.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], much as we would all prefer to believe you will never die. When the inevitable comes to pass, of course I will give [liege_heir.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] what support I can.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2:
My liege,
Your rule is a benevolent one, and while I would prefer to believe you will never die, I know that cannot be. Even so, I cannot offer an oath to [liege_heir.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. None of us knows what the future will bring, nor what place [liege_heir.GetSheHe] will have in it.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledName]

[From.GetTitledName]

column2: Dire events are underway in [Root.Capital.GetName], capital to the mighty [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]: [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], considered by many to be a weak caliph, has been turned into a veritable prisoner within his own palace. His advisors have taken control of the court, and already cracks have begun to appear in its authority over the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]'s vassals. Whether [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will be able to regain control or whether the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] will crumble into anarchy is currently unknown.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] spits at the ragged creature curled into a ball before [From.GetHerHim]. 'This broken old [Root.GetManWoman], covered in [Root.GetHerHis] own filth, dressed in ragged, once-fine robes, is the [Root.GetManWoman] who commanded a hundred legions of infidels to invade Dar al-Islam? You are so pathetic, it is not even worth the torture. Just cut off [Root.GetHerHis] head.' The attendants rush to do just that.

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You pagans may have the trappings of a religion, but you are no better than monkeys, imitating your betters. column2: A radical Muslim preacher and mystic, Fazlallah Astarabadi, has been spreading his kabbalistic Shia heresy all over [hurufi_province.GetName] and the surrounding provinces, drawing great crowds and many disciples. At first he was ignored as just another itinerant madman, but his secular power has grown enough that he can no longer be ignored. The question is now whether his doctrine has any merit to [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], the ruling [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], or whether the heresy will be combated as any other.

column2: The schism at the heart of Islam dates back to its earliest days. The majority Sunnis have long persecuted the followers of Ali, the Shias, forcing them into hiding. The partisans of Ali look to his descendants for leadership, but they are forced to keep their ancestry secret. Now though, the Shias are mobilizing their strength behind a young man by the name of [shiite_revolter.GetFirstName] whom they claim to be Ali's rightful heir and Imam. Other Islamic jurists claim that the boy is clearly a fraud, but to his followers he is the one they have been waiting for and now they flock to his banner as he begins his crusade to wrest the [shiite_revolt_target_title.GetFullName] from the hands of [shiite_revolt_target.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal].

column2: 'I, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], being sane of spirit and body and duly qualified, attest on my soul, without compulsion or constraint, that I renounce all the different cults, religions, and creeds and acknowledge nothing other than obedience to our Lord al-Hakim, revered be his name, and obedience is worship
column3: that in his worship I associate no past, present, or future being
column4: that I commit my soul, my body, my property, and my offspring to our Lord al-Hakim the guide of those who respond to the divine call and the avenger on the polytheists with the sword of our Lord.'\n\nWith those words, you have ascended to the rank of Initiate, and have now been given leave to study the Druze manuscripts and attend the meetings of other Initiates, the true leaders of your faith.

column2: With the ascendance of [Root.GetTitledName] to the rank of Shaykh, the Druze have been given an unprecedented spokes[Root.GetManWoman]. They are no longer the small and oft-maligned group of heretics, but a force that has arrived on the world stage of equal worth to the religions around them. Indeed, they are not truly a Muslim sect, and do not consider themselves such, and with [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] at their head they are now considered a faith in their own right.

column2: The Cathar Church frowns upon contact with members of the opposite sex. Thus you are raised mostly among other Cathar men, and rarely see girls your age at all. You start to feel strange urges, and it occurs to you that the church really only frowns upon reproduction...

column2: After a long search, a young boy has been found who might make for an ideal candidate. Your councillors tell you he comes from an orphanage in [adopted_province.GetName], his parents both killed by a recent plague. Although a bit grimy and shy, you feel the child might make a good ruler one day, provided he is cleaned up and raised properly.

column2: A Cathar heresy has been brewing for some time, begun by numerous ascetic priests who espouse strange beliefs regarding there being two Gods--a 'Good God' who created the spiritual realm, and an 'Evil God' who created the material realm and all of humanity, and the reason why all humans are filled with sin--but with the gathering of these priests at a council in the province of Carcassonne, the heresy has begun to spread like wildfire. At this council, the priests codified many of their laws and spread territories into 'bishoprics', and they have since gained many followers.

column2: The Cathar faithful desire nothing more than peace, but the men of this evil world will not let that be. And so, a change in philosophy is in order. The Cathar are now permitted, no required, to make holy war upon the unbelievers in order to drive them off and bring about the salvation of mankind.

column2: A discredited seminary student by the name of John Wycliff has been spending his time in [new_lollard_stronghold.GetName], preaching his heretical thoughts on the Bible to the peasants--specifically that the Catholic Church must be reformed. He speaks out against the greed and excess of Catholic priests, the Sacrament of the Eucharist, and the over-emphasis of reverence paid to Christian idols. Many peasants, having no love for the corrupt priests of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], have embraced his teachings and the Lollard heresy is spreading like wildfire throughout the countryside.

column2: Translation of the Bible
column3: Translation of the Bible
column4: Translation of the Bible
column6: Translation of the Bible

column2: Several years ago, [Root.GetTitledName] ordered a translation of the Bible into the vernacular. The [Root.Religion.GetName]s believe, after all, that one of the way the Catholic Church maintains control over the masses is by restricting those who can read it to those educated few versed in the ancient tongue of Latin. A non-Latin Bible is, then, something of a revelation. Fortunately, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s Bible is considered to be a fine translation: clear, easy to read, and already quite popular with the common man.

column2: Several years ago, [Root.GetTitledName] ordered a translation of the Bible into the vernacular. The [Root.Religion.GetName]s believe, after all, that one of the way the Catholic Church maintains control over the masses is by restricting those who can read it to those educated few versed in the ancient tongue of Latin. A non-Latin Bible is, then, something of a revelation. Unfortunately for [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [Root.GetHerHis] new Bible is not only considered something of a poor translation -- with far too many parts obviously swayed by the politics of the day -- it is mostly mocked outside of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and mostly disregarded. Even so, it is of great interest to many, and has aided the spread of the [Root.Religion.GetName]s faith.

column2:
[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
You are a holy [Root.GetManWoman], it is true...but you are also not a believer in the ideals we Lollards uphold. You revel in excess and greed, and thus I cannot allow you to retain your titles in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. They are to be revoked at once, and given to a more worthy member of the clergy.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2:
[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
Since you are a priest who understands the tenets of the Lollard faith, you will see why I have come to the belief that you have gained far too many titles for your station. A good [Root.GetManWoman] of the Lord should attend to more simple matters. Thus I hereby declare that your greater titles be claimed by the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledFirstName]

column2: Brother Angelo
column3: Brother Angelo

column6: Brother Angelo

column2: A disgruntled Catholic monk by the name of Brother Angelo has heavily criticized [Root.GetTitledName], and in so doing has rocked the authority of the Roman Catholic Church. Brother Angelo denies that [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is legally the pope, as [Root.GetSheHe] has abrogated the Rule of St. Francis -- which, according to his doctrine, represented the pure and simple Gospel. He has asserted that all of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s decrees are thus invalid, and that all Catholics who follow the Pope's will have lost the grace of God.

column2: The Poor of Lyons
column3: The Poor of Lyons
column4: The Poor of Lyons
column6: The Poor of Lyons

column2: A wealthy merchant of Lyons by the name of Pierre Valdes gave up all his earthly possessions and began wandering the countryside as a preacher after a brush with death. He has been condemning the Catholic Church for its corruption, as well as calling for a return to a more Biblical lifestyle. The man has rapidly gained followers amongst the poor of Lyons, and his disciples have ranged even further and begun seeking converts in northern Italy -- enough to cause considerable concern within the Catholic hierarchy.

column2: The founding of the Waldensian Church was mostly underground, and the so the early initiates organized themselves into cells. The Doctores would lead the cells and train Novellani, who would go and preach to the masses, while the Sandaliati would travel to keep the cells in touch. It is a tradition that has continued to this day.

column2: As your men storm the church, you cut down a [From.Owner.Religion.GetName] priest trying to protect a relic, gilded in gold. These false idols are a means to deceive the peasants and confuse ignorant fools. You are of half a mind to destroy them and return the wealth to the people.

column2: After the Waldensians seized Rome, they proceeded to destroy any and all holy relics they could reach, stripping all the wealth from the Roman churches. The bones of St. Peter have been thrown out and cast into the street, the Chains of St. Paul melted down, and the Scala Santa smashed and destroyed. Catholics everywhere are distraught.

column2: In a dark cellar, at the stroke of midnight, you take the oath. Surrounded by pentagrams, ram skulls and strange inscriptions written in no modern tongue, you swear to keep and preserve the secrets of Cult, and to die before revealing any of them. There, you learn the secret Truths of Heaven and Hell, passed down from Adelphius himself...

column2: The Army of Lucifer
column3: The Army of Lucifer
column4: The Army of Lucifer
column6: The Army of Lucifer

column2: The growing power of the Messalians can no longer be denied. With the aid of [Root.GetTitledName], a group of fanatics, peasants, and madmen have now banded together to create their own army -- one that has, much to the shock of Christians elsewhere in the world, taken as its patron saint none other than Lucifer the Lighbringer, greatest of the Archangels and the King of Hell. Lucifer, they believe, is no more than an agent of chaos and change, and in His name they intend to bring about a change in the world. They will drive the demons of sin from the ranks of humanity with the force of their arms...if they are given the chance, that is.

column2:
My [Root.GetLordLady],
I have thought long and hard about this, and I believe I have come to the conclusion that I must dedicate my life utterly to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. With your permission, I wish to join a monastery, though of course I will be available at court, should you need me.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

column4: The Order of Saint Blaise

column2: In order the stem the tide of infidels and heretics bearing down upon the innocent faithful, a small army of Armenian soldiers and clerics have banded together under the banner of Saint Blaise. With the Latins and Greeks pushing from the west and the Muslims from the East, there is very little these men have aside from unshakeable faith in the power of God to stand between them and their enemies.

column6: The Knights of Saint Mark

column2: In order the protect the oppressed faithful from the iron scepter of Muslim domination and the encroachment of the schismatics, the Knights of Saint Mark has arisen to preserve the Coptic populations scattered throughout Egypt and Abyssinia. Tales abound of their courage and tenacity, even against innumerably greater odds.

column2: Above the gate to a city in [acheiropoieta_province.GetName], there is enshrined an Acheiropoieta: an icon which, it is claimed, was not created by human hands but rather came into existence miraculously. All icons in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are condemned to be destroyed, but the people of [acheiropoieta_province.GetName] have refused to destroy the Acheiropoieta, claiming its divine heritage shelters the city from danger. [iconoclast_patriarch.GetTitledName] has, however, demanded you deal it regardless.

column2: Constantine's Return
column3: Constantine's Return
column4: Constantine's Return
column6: Constantine's Return

column2: The war is not going well, and many parts of the empire are already in chaos. Now, a group of soldiers has reportedly broken into the imperial mausoleum in the Church of the Holy Apostles, opened the sarcophagus of Constantine V, and implored him to return and save the empire. Iconoclast zealots have been quick to jump on this news, claiming it is Orthodox idolatry that is dooming the emperor. They have pleaded with [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to honor the memory of the former emperor and lead the emperor away from its idolatrous ways before it is too late.

column2: While the Paulician faith has been riven by internal conflicts for the last few decades, the heresy has a new leader in [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], a zealous priest of [Root.Culture.GetName] origin as well as an effective converter. He has spread his sect throughout Armenian lands ruled by the Byzantine Empire, and is very quickly becoming a major problem for Orthodox rulers.

column2: All across the Byzantine Empire, Paulicians are being violently persecuted on the order of [Root.GetTitledName]. They are rounded up and imprisoned, their homes burned and their belongings seized. All Paulician courtiers have been ordered either executed or banished.

column2: A heresiarch by the name of 'Bogomil', which may not even be his true name, has appeared in the province of Kossovo, capitalizing on the anger of the locals following their conversion from pagan ways. His teachings of a heresy that seems to combine Christianity with a combination of Gnostic dualism and anti-church sentiment has caught on extremely quickly in both Kossovo and the surrounding areas, presenting a challenge to [Root.GetTitledName]'s rule as well as to the authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. Some believe that this 'Bogomil' has reached the court of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], and that [Root.GetSheHe] might even be considered a conversion to these heretical beliefs.

column2: The formalization process of Bogomilism has officially begun, with [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] meeting with a group of perfecti leaders in [Root.Capital.GetName] and expressing [Root.GetHerHis] desire to see the faith go from a disorganized movement to one fully integrated with [Root.GetHerHis] rule. They expressed doubt, but were willing to hear [Root.GetHerHim] out, for the time being.

column2: [Root.GetTitledName]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the Bogomilist faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have been rewarded after a recent meeting of Perfecti in [Root.Capital.GetName]. They finally agreed to a common liturgy, so that ceremonies performed across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] use a common set of prayers and rituals, and that this will be taught to new Perfecti going forward.

column2: Up until now, Bogomilist priests have all used different letters and gospels in their preaching, a result of the scattered and disparate beginnings of the faith. At the behest of [Root.GetTitledName], the '[Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] Bible' has been written and agred upon as canon by a council of Perfecti in [Root.Capital.GetName].

column2: In order to continue the process of formalizing the Bogomilist faith, the scattered preachers and Perfecti will need to be gathered together in councils. They resist such efforts an organization, however, and the only way to see it done will be with coin -- for the poor, for shrines, for bribes, and for God.

column2: A Bogomilist Perfecti has approached you with an idea for continuing your efforts to formalize your faith: the construction of several seminary schools across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], each teaching a common and unified version of Bogomilism dogma to future preachers. column2: Recently, a new sect of Bogomilist has been spreading in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], one that advocates a radically different version of the faith. Normally this would not be an issue, as the sect is not popular, but it has proven disruptive to your efforts to formalize Bogomilism, as their presence has prompted other sects to follow suit.

column2: A recent revival of Bogomilist traditionalism has taken hold in [PrimaryTitle.GetName], with numerous preachers cropping up who actively deride your efforts to reform the faith as being exactly the same sort of tyrannical structure they rebelled against in the first place. Needless to say, this has not been helpful.

column2: A prominent Perfecti in [demand_province.GetName] has publicly begged that you slow down, if not outright stop, the process of Bogomilist reform. The common folk are confused by these contradictions, he says, and continuing down this path too quickly will only bring down God's wrath. The Perfecti is too popular to be silenced, as doing so would turn him into a martyr for his cause.

column2: A set of crop failures and other disasters that has fallen one of your provinces in recent months has stirred the ire of several fiery preaches in the area. They say that you are to blame, that your desire for reforms and general lack of piety is what has brought down God's wrath upon the people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Sadly, their words have taken hold amongst many.

They say that you are to blame, that your desire for reforms and general lack of piety is what has brought down God's wrath upon the people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Sadly, their words have taken hold amongst many.

column2: A prominent Perfecti has recently taken issue with your desire to reform the Bogomilist faith, pointing out a number of flaws in your argument without ever actually saying outright that your intention is solely to grab power and force the faithful into compliance. To her, you are not a learned enough [Root.GetManWoman] to push such things forward, and there is no convincing her otherwise.

column2: In its inception, the Bogomilist faith was only loosely organized. It didn't believe in formal churches, and opposed any kind of formal hierarchy -- this has all changed with the leadership of [Root.GetTitledName], whose piety and status as a Perfecti has encouraged all members of [Root.GetHerHis] faith to reconsider their resistance to feudal structures. Bogomilists across the world are now more formally organized, though many still do not consider them a true religion, and they remain opposed to any kind of formal church that emulates the Orthodox priesthood. Even so, there are many that object to even these changes, saying that Bogomilism has betrayed its own roots at a powerful [Root.GetLordLady]'s behest.

column2: Though the faithful were hardly ready for it, Bogomilism has now been formalized as a structured religion thanks to the leadership of [Root.GetTitledName]. While many see [Root.GetHerHis] leadership and piety as being worthwhile to follow, there are many who claim [Root.GetSheHe] has dragged the faith too fast into something which too much resembles the very kind of tyrannical structures they once abandoned. Preachers throughout [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are questioning how far this will go, and whether the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] has not perhaps betrayed Bogomilism's principles for the sake of power. Whatever the case, Bogomilist priests are now unified under a common liturgy, a single sacred text, and operate out of temples -- far more than the disparate heretics from where they sprang.

column2: After a long and arduous process of reform, the Bogomilist faith can now truly be considered a formal religion. Under the considered leadership and piety of [Root.GetTitledName], Bogomilist priests are now unified under a common liturgy, a single sacred text, and operate out of temples -- far more than the disparate heretics from where they sprang. While some question whether these reforms betray the principles upon which Bogomilism was founded, far more say they were agreed to by all and with due consideration. The faith is now ready to come into its own.

column2: At the behest of [council_holder.GetTitledName], an ecumenical council is to take place at [council_location.GetName], one which many believe will end the Great Schism which has divided the western and eastern branches of Christianity once and for all. [target_religion.GetTitledName] is said to be arriving, as is a horde of priests, patriarchs, and senior members of both the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] and [target_religion.Religion.GetName] faiths. Unlike previous councils, there is a feeling that the Great Schism may actually be resolved -- indeed, with the influence that [council_holder.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] holds amongst the faithful, it may very well be that the [target_religion.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] has no choice but to agree to the council's resolutions even if the result would turn [target_religion.GetHerHim] into a virtual heretic. [target_religion.Religion.GetName] rulers across the world are already considering whether they must submit to this new order of [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] dominance.

column2: After more than a month of heated deliberations, the Council of [council_location.GetName] has ended. The process began by [council_holder.GetTitledName] has ended with the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] faith standing triumphant. column2: At the behest of [council_holder.GetTitledName], an ecumenical council is to take place at [council_location.GetName], one which seems ready to finally resolve the Council of Ephesus from the 5th Century -- that historic event which originally repudiated Nestorianism and caused the creation of the Church of the East. [target_religion.GetTitledName] is said to be arriving, as is a large number of priests, patriarchs, and senior members of both the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] and [target_religion.Religion.GetName] faiths, almost too many for [council_location.GetName] to contain. With [council_holder.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s influence backing the council, it is believed the Nestorians will be brought into the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] fold, something even the [target_religion.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] will likely have no choice but to agree to even if this will turn [target_religion.GetHerHim] into a virtual heretic. Already [target_religion.Religion.GetName] rulers across the world are considering whether they will heed the council's wishes and convert.

column2: At the behest of [council_holder.GetTitledName], an ecumenical council is to take place at [council_location.GetName], one which seems ready to finally resolve the Council of Chalcedon from the 5th Century -- that historic event which originally repudiated 'monophysitism' and caused its believers to split from the Christian Church. Both [target_religion1.GetTitledName] [target_religion2.GetTitledName] are said to be arriving, as is a large number of priests, patriarchs, and senior members of the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] faith. With [council_holder.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s influence backing the council, it is believed the miaphysites will finally be brought into the fold, something even the [target_religion1.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] and [target_religion2.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] will be powerless to oppose. Already [target_religion1.Religion.GetName]  and [target_religion2.Religion.GetName] rulers across the world are considering whether they will heed the council's wishes and convert.

column2: At the behest of [council_holder.GetTitledName], an unprecedented ecumenical council is to take place at [council_location.GetName], one which will address the Council of Ephesus from the 5th Century -- that historic event which originally repudiated Nestorianism and caused the creation of the Church of the East. This time, however, Nestorianism is set to unite the eastern churches under its doctrine. [target_religion.GetTitledName] is said to be arriving, as is a large number of priests, patriarchs, and senior members of both the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] and [target_religion.Religion.GetName] faiths. With [council_holder.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s influence backing the council, the [target_religion.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] will likely have no choice but to accede to the council even if this will turn [target_religion.GetHerHim] into a virtual heretic. Already [target_religion.Religion.GetName] rulers across the world are considering whether to accept the inevitable and convert.

The process began by [council_holder.GetTitledName] has resulted in the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] faith standing triumphant. What few members of the [target_religion.Religion.GetName] faith remain are now considered heretics, with most having already converted. Christianity is at last united under the [mender_religion.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], a single force to spread the Gospel across the known world.

column2: Sahidic culture has been present ever since Saint Mark introduced Christianity to Egypt shortly after Christ's ascension. We speak our own language and maintain our own traditions, as we have for centuries. To some, we are the only true Egyptians that remained once the Muslims took over most of North Africa. As I am a Christian myself, perhaps it is time I embrace that distinction from the Arabs around me?

column2: The Journey of Nerthus

column6: The Journey of Nerthus

column2: With [nerthus_top_liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in a time of peace, [Root.GetTitledName] has declared that the time has come for the Journey of Nerthus. The fertility goddess will travel across the land in a covered chariot, with only [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] permitted to look upon her, her arrival in each hold calling for a time of feasting and celebration. It is one of the most holy of Germanic traditions, a period during which lords are not permitted to engage in war, at least until the goddess tires of her travels and retires to the sacred grove again.

column2: With the feasts throughout [nerthus_top_liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] now done, and the holy cart having completed its circuit throughout the land, the goddess Nerthus has apparently tired of her communications with mortal men and returned to the sacred grove in Castum. [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has declared the holy time at an end, with the fields now blessed and many married women now hoping to conceive in this most auspicious period following the journey's close.

column2: Irminsul Reborn

column2: At no small expense, a new world tree has been planted in the sacred woods outside of Paderborn -- not far from the location where the previous Irminsul was destroyed. There have been months of careful rites performed, the ground consecrated with the blood of many slaves, and it has been determined that this time it will not be so easy for the tree to be violated as it was previously. A great wrong to the Germanic faith has now been undone.

column2: One by one, the Lords and Ladies of the faction assemble at my residence in [Root.Capital.GetName]. It is quite clear that the prevailing mood is that of fondness towards [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and that things are going well in [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. As faction leader, it is up to me to address them and determine the agenda for the meeting to come.

column2: With a steady voice and eloquent rhetoric, you deliver what is perhaps the greatest speech of your life. Praising your friends, denouncing your enemies and subtly reinforcing your virtues, you soon have the whole faction on their feet, applauding and shouting your name.
column3: Avec une voix assurée et une rhétorique éloquente, vous donnez ce qui est peult-estre le plus grand discours de votre vie. Louant vos amis, accusant vos ennemis et soulignant subtilement vos vertus, la faction entière est bientost à vos pieds, applaudissant et criant votre nom.

column2: Speaking to the assembled Lords, you manage to win over most of the audience with your skillful rhetoric and even elicit some applause and cheering at the end.
column3: En parlant aulx Seigneurs réunis avec une rhétorique maitrisée, vous réussissez à rallier à votre cause la majeure partie de l'audience,et mesme à susciter quelques acclamations et applaudissements à la fin.

column6: Speaking to the assembled Lords, you manage to win over most of the audience with your skillful rhetoric and even elicit some applause and cheering at the end.

column2: Stumbling on a word here and there, you nonetheless manage to deliver a more or less coherent speech to the assembled Lords. The applause is merely polite, but at least nobody is heckling you.
column3: Trébuchant sur quelques mots, vous réussissez néamoins à donner un discours plus ou moins cohérent aulx Seigneurs réunis. Des applaudissements polis résonnent, mais au moins personne ne vous siffle.
column4: Stumbling on a word here and there, you nonetheless manage to deliver a more or less coherent speech to the assembled Lords. The applause is merely polite, but at least nobody is heckling you.
column6: Stumbling on a word here and there, you nonetheless manage to deliver a more or less coherent speech to the assembled Lords. The applause is merely polite, but at least nobody is heckling you.

column2: Your attempts to win over the assembled Lords with your rhetoric falls on deaf ears. You stumble on phrasing, mispronounce words and forget the name of an important noble in the room. What little applause you get at the end is muted by jeers, but at least nobody is laughing.
column3: Vos efforts rhétoriques pour rassembler les Seigneurs réunis à votre cause tombent dans l'oreille d'un sourd. Vous bégayez, écorchez des mots et oubliez le nom d'un noble important.Les quelques applaudissements sont étouffés par les huées, mais au moins personne ne rit.
column4: Your attempts to win over the assembled Lords with your rhetoric falls on deaf ears. You stumble on phrasing, mispronounce words and forget the name of an important noble in the room. What little applause you get at the end is muted by jeers, but at least nobody is laughing.

column2: Mere seconds after you begin to speak to the assembled Lords, you know that things are about to go badly. What follows are several long minutes of humiliation as you struggle your way through what you intended to be an inspiring speech. In the end, you are laughed out of the room and uncermoniously removed from leadership.
column3: Quelques secondes après avoir commencé à parler aulx Seigneurs réunis, vous savez que les choses vont mal se passer. Ce qui suit sont plusieurs longues minutes d'humiliation alors que vous peinez à donner ce qui auroit du estre un discours inspirant. A la fin, les rires vous chassent de la pièce et votre position de meneur vous est retirée sans cérémonie.

column2: Speaking to the assembled Lords, I denounced the misrule of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and reminded my fellow vassals of how our rights and liberties were being taken away. I could tell they took my words seriously, and the meeting ended with agreement that we must find a way to reduce the power of the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].

column2: [From.GetBestName] stands up before the assembled Lords and proposes the payment of membership dues, to strengthen our cause and allow us to stand together against our foes. Though [From.GetSheHe] claims unselfish motives, opponents of the proposal claim that [From.GetSheHe] intends to seize the funds for [From.GetHerHim]self.
column3: [From.GetBestName] se tient devant les Seigneurs réunis et propose le paiement de cotisations, pour renforcer notre cause et nous permettre de nous tenir coste-à-coste contre nos ennemis. Mesme si [From.GetSheHe] prétend que c'est un geste altruiste, ses opposant clament que [From.GetSheHe] veult saisir les fonds ainsi rassemblés pour s'enrichir personnelement.

column2:
My liege,
For too long, the crown has restricted our historic rights and liberties. The time has come to lower the Crown Authority! Submit to this demand peacefully or face the consequences. Rest assured that I have gathered others who are equally upset...

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[From.GetTitledName]

column2:
My liege,
The tax demands placed on your feudal lords is impoverishing our realms and endangering our ability to give military service to the crown. My faction formally demands a reduction in the tax burden on all feudal lords, else drastic measured become required.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2:
Dear [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
I am in receipt of your so-called 'demand', but I cannot for the life of me fathom what it means. Perhaps you have forgotten which of us is the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] and which is the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]? Do what you must, if you have the spine.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2: Swords have been sharpened and oaths sworn. My fellow faction members assure me that they are ready for war. The time to overthrow [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] is finally here.

column4: Schwerter wurde geschärft und Eide geschworen. Meine Kolleginnen und Splittergruppesmitglieder versichern mir dass sie bereit für den Krieg sind. Die Zeit um [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] zu stürzen, ist endlich da.

column2: [From.GetTitledName] has begun a civil war in [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] to overthrow [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. column2: The First Temple, built by King Solomon, was destroyed by the invading Babylonians. The Second Temple, built under the auspices of Cyrus the Great of Persia, was razed by the Romans after a terrible siege. The Third Temple, however, built by the great [Root.GetTitledFirstName], shall stand for all eternity!\n\nFrom its position on Temple Mount, the magnificent building has become a dominant feature of Jerusalem, instantly recognizable from far away by travellers approaching the city. [new_kohen_gadol.GetTitledName] has assumed [new_kohen_gadol.GetHerHis] position as the first Kohen Gadol is the Second Temple's destruction, leading a rebuilding of the Jewish priesthood who can now be seen throughout Jerusalem on a daily basis. Truly, Solomon himself would have been moved to tears by the sight.

column2: There has not been a Kohen Gadol – a High Priest of Judaism – since the Romans destroyed the Second Temple roughly a thousand years ago. At long last, this position has been filled and the High Priesthood reconstituted.\n\nThe Samaritans have held the tradition of a Kohen Gadol steadfast, despite their exile from the Holy Land and so the Kohen Gadol himself now returns to where he belongs.
column3: Il n'y a point eu de Kohen Gadol – un Grand Prestre du Judaisme – depuis que les Romains ont détruit le Second Temple il y a de ça environ mille ans. Mais enfin, quelqu'un remplit ce rosle et le Haut Sacerdoce a été reconstitué.\n\nLes Samaritains ont constamment maintenu la tradition d'un Kohen Gadol, malgré leur exil de la Terre Sainte et c'est ainsi que Kohen Gadol lui-mesme retourne à présent là où il appartient.

column2:
Most righteous [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
The [holy_order_name.GetFullName] needs more castles in order to train troops and generate a supporting income. It has come to my attention that there is a suitable location in your demesne - in [desired_province.GetName], to be specific. I am willing to pay you 100 gold in exchange for the right to construct a fortress there.

May [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] be with you,
[From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] [From.GetFirstName]

column2: Harkening back to the early days of Islam, the Ansar have adopted the name given to Muhammad's first allies in Medina, who helped the Prophet's companions in the war against the Quraysh. Like the original Ansar, the new holy warriors will assist the leaders of orthodox Islam in spreading the religion of God, by sword if need be.
column3: Une secte soufie de derviches est apparue sous le commandement d'un certain Haci Bektas Veli, un mystique natif du Khorassan. Œuvrant pour ce qu'ils appellent l'Unité de l'Estre, les Bektachis forment leurs asmes à la méditation et la contemplation du sens caché du Coran. La Confrérie des Bektachis est un ordre guerrier particulièrement apprécié des soldats musulmans [Root.Religion.GetName]. L'ordre a juré de protéger l'Islam et de guerroyer contre les infidèles et les polythéistes de toutes sortes.
column4: Unter der Führerschaft eines gewissen Hadschi Baktasch Wali, eines Mystikers aus Khorosan, ist eine Sufi-Sekte aus Derwischen entstanden. In ihrem Streben nach der Einheit des Seins ertüchtigen die Bektaschis ihre Seele durch Meditation und Kontemplation der wahren Bedeutung des Korans. Der kriegerische Bektaschi-Orden ist besonders bei jungen [Root.Religion.GetName] Soldaten beliebt. Die Mitglieder leisten einen Eid, den Islam zu schützen und Ungläubige und Polytheisten jeder Art zu belämpfen.
column6: Ha surgido una secta sufí de derviches bajo el liderazgo de un tal Hadji Bektash Wali, un místico de Jorasán. Los Bektashis aspiran a la Unidad del Ser” y educan el alma a través de la meditación y la contemplación del significado interno del Corán. La Orden Bektashi es favorable a la guerra y especialmente popular entre los soldados musulmanes [Root.Religion.GetName]. La Orden ha jurado proteger el Islam y combatir a los infieles y politeístas de todo tipo.

column2: More fanatics for our blades!
column3: Des soldats mystiques ? Pouah !
column4: Mystische Soldaten? Pah!
column6: ¿Soldados místicos? ¡Bah!

column2: Most righteous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], of course we, the Ansar, can lend you 300 gold. All that we ask in return is your future assistance in certain matters as they might arise. Salaam alaykum,\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]
column3: Très vertueulx [Root.GetTitledFirstName], la Confrérie des Bektachis peult bien évidemment vous prester 300 or. La chose que nous demandons en contrepartie est votre aide future lorsque certains besoins se feront sentir. As-salasm 'aleïkoum,\n\nGrand Maistre [From.GetFirstName]
column4: Hochwohlgeborener [Root.GetTitledFirstName], natürlich können wir, der Bektaschi-Orden, Euch 300 Gold leihen. Als Gegenleistung erbitten wir lediglich Eure Unterstützung in gewissen Angelegenheiten, die sich ergeben könnten. Salaam alaykum,\n\nGroßmeister [From.GetFirstName]
column6: Mi justo [Root.GetTitledFirstName], por supuesto que nosotros, la Orden Bektashi, podemos prestarle 300 oros. Todo lo que pedimos a cambio es su futura asistencia en determinados asuntos que puedan surgir. Salaam alaykum,\n\nGran Maestre [From.GetFirstName]

column2: The Ansar have constructed a castle in [Root.GetName]!
column3: La Confrérie des Bektachis a édifié un castel en [Root.GetName] !
column4: Der Bektaschi-Orden hat in [Root.GetName] eine Burg errichtet!
column6: ¡La Orden Bektashi ha construido un castillo en [Root.GetName]!

column2: My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has requested to join the Ansar to fight the infidel! This will forever disinherit him and he will never disgrace the dynasty with his decadence.
column3: Mon [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], a demandé à rejoindre les Bektachis dans leur lutte contre les infidèles ! Cela le déshéritera à jamais mais il ne déshonorera jamais la dynastie par sa décadence !
column4: Mein [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName] will dem Bektaschi-Orden beitreten, um gegen die Ungläubigen zu kämpfen! Das wird ihn auf ewig von der Erbfolge ausschließen und er wird niemals durch seine Dekadenz der Dynastie Schande bereiten.
column6: ¡Mi [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] ha solicitado unirse a la Orden Bektashi para combatir a los infieles! Esta acción le desheredará para siempre y su decadencia no traerá nunca la desgracia a esta dinastía.

column2:
My [Root.GetLordLady],
I have done the impossible and assembled a force with which I hope to take what you and I both agree rightfully belongs to me. I have always appreciated the support of you and your followers, and now would be the time to rise up against [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] and see the matter done.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

column3: It was good while it lasted
column4: It was good while it lasted
column6: It was good while it lasted

column2: The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Norse culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Icelandic.
column3: Le peuple de [Root.GetName] a développé sa langue et ses coutumes à un point tel qu'il est maintenant considéré comme une branche distincte de la culture nordique. Ses gens ont commencé à se définir en tant que Norvégiens.
column4: Die Menschen von [Root.GetName] haben ihre Kultur und Sprache soweit entwickelt, dass sie nun als eigener Zweig der nordischen Kultur betrachtet werden können. Sie haben begonnen, sich selbst als Norweger zu bezeichnen.
column6: Los habitantes de [Root.GetName] han desarrollado su idioma y sus costumbres hasta el punto en que ahora pueden ser considerados parte de una rama distinta de la cultura Nórdica. Han comenzado a referirse a sí mismos como Noruegos.

column2: What will they think of next, I wonder.
column3: Je me demande quelle sera leur prochaine lubie.
column4: Ich frage mich, was sie sich wohl als Nächstes überlegen werden.
column6: Me pregunto qué será lo siguiente.

column2: Welcome into the fold, my Icelandic brothers and sisters.
column3: Bien vaigniez au bercail, mes frères et sœurs norvégiens.
column4: Willkommen im Schoß der Familie, meine norwegischen Brüder und Schwestern.
column6: Bienvenidos al redil, mis hermanos y hermanas Noruegos.

column2: Yes... yes. I just need a moment to collect my wits.
column3: Oui... oui. J'ai seulement besoin d'un moment pour rassembler mes esprits.
column4: Ja, ja. Lasst mich nur zur Besinnung kommen.
column6: Si… si. Sólo necesito un momento para recobrar el juicio.

column2: Varangian raiders sailing from the distant north down the rivers leading into the Black Sea have proven themselves to be formidable warriors. You have managed to recruit a great many of their number into a personal guard loyal only to the [Root.GetTitle].\n\nThis new Varangian Guard will not only form a powerful shock force against the Empire's many enemies, but their foreign roots should also preclude them from becoming too entangled in the palace intrigue and power struggles that are so commonplace in the court.
column3: Les pillards varègues qui, depuis le nord lointain, voguent sur les fleuves qui se jettent dans la mer Noire, ont prouvé qu'ils estoient de redoutables guerriers. Vous avez réussi à recruter moult d'entre eulx pour monter une garde personnelle de soldats totalement loyaulx envers leur [Root.GetTitle].\n\nL'avantage de cette nouvelle Garde varègue est non seulement de former une puissante force de frappe contre les nombreulx ennemis de l'empire, mais aussi d'estre détachée, par ses racines étrangères, des complots et des jeulx de pouvoir qui ont lieu au palais et qui sont monnaie courante à Constantinople.
column4: Warägerräuber, die aus dem fernen Norden die Flüsse bis zum Schwarzen Meer segelten, haben sich als herausragende Krieger erwiesen. Euch ist es gelungen, eine große Anzahl von ihnen als Leibwache zu rekrutieren, die nur gegenüber dem [Root.GetTitle] loyal ist.\n\n Diese neue Warägergarde stellt nicht nur eine mächtige Stoßtruppe dar, ihre ausländische Herkunft sollte auch sicherstellen, dass sie nicht allzu sehr in die Intrigen und Machtspiele verwickelt werden, die so typisch für Konstantinopel sind.
column6: Los invasores Varangianos navegando desde el lejano norte por los ríos que llevan al Mar Negro han demostrado ser guerreros formidables. Tú has logrado reclutar un gran número de ellos para una guardia personal leal sólo al [Root.GetTitle].\n\nEsta nueva Guardia Varangiana no sólo formará una gran fuerza contra los muchos enemigos del Imperio, sino que también sus raíces extranjeras impedirán que se enreden demasiado en la intriga palaciega y las luchas de poder que son tan comunes en Constantinopla.

column2: They shall serve me well.
column3: Ils devroient bien me servir.
column4: Sie werden mir gut dienen.
column6: Me servirán bien.

column2: [From.GetFirstName] is distraught over the poor mettle of his countrymen. Knowing well our skill in battle, he has decided to form a bodyguard consisting solely of Norse warriors.\n\nThose who serve him in the great city of Miklagård are generously rewarded, and even now many of our young men, eager for riches and adventure, have departed for Greece to pick up his banner.
column3: [From.GetFirstName] est angoissé par le peu de courage de ses compatriotes. Connaissant bien notre aptitude au combat, il a décidé de composer son équipe de gardes du corps uniquement de guerriers nordiques.\n\nCeulx qui le servent dans la grande cité de Miklagård sont généreusement récompensés et, aujourd'hui encor, les jeunes hommes avides de richesse et d'aventure quittent pour la Grèce afin de le servir.
column4: [From.GetFirstName] ist bestürzt über den lausigen Eifer seiner Landsmänner. Euren Kampfesmut kennend, hat er beschlossen, eine Leibwache nur aus nordischen Kriegern aufzustellen.\n\nWer ihm in Miklagard dient, wird reich belohnt und viele Eurer jungen Männer, erpicht auf Gold und Abenteuer, sind nach Griechenland abgereist, um in seinen Dienst zu treten.
column6: [From.GetFirstName] está perturbado por el poco ánimo de sus compatriotas. Conociendo bien nuestra habilidad en la batalla, ha decidido formar una guardia que consiste únicamente de guerreros Nórdicos.\n\nAquellos que le sirven en la gran ciudad de Miklagård son generosamente recompensados, e incluso ahora muchos de nuestros jóvenes, ávidos de riquezas y aventura, han partido hacia Grecia para levantar su estandarte.

column2: The pillaging and looting undertaken in your name has earned you a reputation as a fearsome raider. All along the coasts of Europe, mothers tucking their children in for the night warn that unless they behave, the terrible [Root.GetFirstName], will come with his undead warriors and eat them.
column3: The pillaging and looting undertaken in your name has earned you a reputation as a fearsome raider. All along the coasts of Europe, mothers tucking their children in for the night warn that unless they behave, the terrible [Root.GetFirstName], will come with his undead warriors and eat them.

column2: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has avoided me for some time now, and the rare occasions when we meet have turned from the nights of passion I remember to evenings of arguments and disagreement. It did not come as a shock when [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] told me [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] no longer loves me, but it hurt more than I thought it would.
column3: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] m'évite depuis longtemps maintenant, et les occasions rares de nos rencontres donnent désormais lieu à des disputes, alors qu'auparavant elles donnaient lieu à des nuits de passion. Le choc a été minime quand [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] a avoué ne plus ressentir d'amour pour moi, mais la douleur fut plus intense que ce à quoi je m'attendais.
column4: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] meidet mich seit einer Weile und von der früheren Leidenschaft ist nichts mehr geblieben. Stattdessen streiten wir uns. Es war keine Überraschung, als [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] mir sagte, [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] liebte mich nicht mehr. Und doch war es schmerzvoller, als ich erwartet hatte.
column6: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] lleva un tiempo evitándome y las raras ocasiones que nos encontramos las noches de pasión que recordaba se han convertido en tardes de discusiones y desacuerdos. No me sorprendió que [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] me dijera que ya no me ama, pero duele más de lo que pensé que lo haría.

column2: But we are both married...

column4: Aber [From.GetSheHe] ist verheiratet ...

column2: But I shouldn't go any further...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] and I shared a night of passion, and now...
column3: J'ai partagée une nuit d’amour avec [From.GetTitledFirstName], et maintenant...
column4: [From.GetTitledFirstName] und ich verbracht hatten eine leidenschaftliche Nacht, und jetzt...
column6: La noche de pasión que [From.GetTitledFirstName] y yo compartimos resultó en...

column2: I made sure the most beautiful guest would be my dinner partner and during the feast I kept refilling both our wine glasses. My charm and my winning smile made it impossible for them to stay unresponsive, it didn't take long until they looked at me with more than interest in their eyes...
column3: J’ai veillé à me placer auprès de la plus jolie femme et lors du banquet, je n’ai cessé de remplir nos verres de vin. Elle a succombé à mon charme et à mon sourire ravageur, me renvoyant des regards enjôleurs...
column4: Ich sorgte dafür, dass die schönste Dame während des Abendmahls neben mir saß. Während des Gelages füllte ich dann immerzu unsere Weingläser. Meinem Charme und gewinnenden Lächeln konnte sie nicht widerstehen, und so dauerte es nicht lange, bis sie mich mit verlangenden Augen ansah ...
column6: Me aseguré de que la más bella de las mujeres se sentara a comer conmigo, y durante el banquete no paré de rellenar nuestras copas de vino. Con mi encanto y mi sonrisa irresistible era imposible que no reaccionara. No tardó mucho en mirarme con algo más que interés en los ojos...

column2: Rumors reach you regarding [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName], the mercenary. You always knew [From.GetHerHim] as a coward, but now the word is that [From.GetSheHe] has been cured of [From.GetHerHis] shameful fear of battle.
column3: Des rumeurs vous sont parvenues concernant votre [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName], le mercenaire. Vous l'avez toujours connu comme étant un lâche mais il paraît qu'[From.GetSheHe] n'a désormais plus peur de se battre.
column4: Ein Gerücht aus Söldnerkreisen erreicht Euch. Demzufolge hat [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] durch das Söldnerleben tatsächlich das Fürchten verlernt und seine beschämende Angst vor einer Schlacht abgelegt.
column6: Te llegan rumores sobre [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName], el mercenario. Siempre creíste que era un cobarde, pero ahora se dice que [From.GetSheHe] se ha curado de [From.GetHerHis] temor vergonzoso a la batalla.
